sourceString: Rapidly increasing cumulative incidence of coronavirus disease (COVID-19) in the European Union/European Economic Area and the United Kingdom, 1 January to 15 March 2020
targetString: यूरोपीय संघ / यूरोपीय आर्थिक क्षेत्र और यूनाइटेड किंगडम में कोरोनावायरस रोग (COVID-19) की तेजी से बढ़ रही संचयी व्यापकता, 1 जनवरी से 15 मार्च 2020 तक
en-mt: European Union/ The rapidly increasing cumulative prevalence of coronavirus disease (COVID-19) in the European Economic Area and the United Kingdom, from 1 January to 15 March 2020

sourceString: The cumulative incidence of coronavirus disease (COVID-19) cases is showing similar trends in European Union/European Economic Area countries and the United Kingdom confirming that, while at a different stage depending on the country, the COVID-19 pandemic is progressing rapidly in all countries.
targetString: कोरोनावायरस रोग (COVID-19) मामलों की संचयी व्यापकता यूरोपीय संघ/यूरोपीय आर्थिक क्षेत्र के देशों और यूनाइटेड किंगडम में समान प्रवृत्ति दिखा रही है जो इस बात की पुष्टि करती है कि देश के आधार पर विभिन्न चरण पर होते हुए COVID-19 महामारी सभी देशों में तेजी से बढ़ रही है।
en-mt: The cumulative prevalence of coronavirus disease (COVID-19) cases is showing a similar trend in countries in the European Union/European Economic Area and the United Kingdom, confirming that the COVID-19 pandemic is increasing rapidly in all countries, at different stages depending on the country.

sourceString: Based on the experience from Italy, countries, hospitals and intensive care units should increase their preparedness for a surge of patients with COVID-19 who will require healthcare, and in particular intensive care.
targetString: इटली से अनुभव के आधार पर, देशों, अस्पतालों और गहन देखभाल इकाइयों को COVID-19 के रोगियों में तेजी से बढ़ोतरी के लिए अपनी तैयारी बढ़ानी चाहिए जिन्हें स्वास्थ्य देखभाल की आवश्यकता होगी, विशेष रूप से गहन देखभाल की।
en-mt: Based on experience from Italy, countries, hospitals and intensive care units should increase their preparedness for the rapid increase in patients with COVID-19 who will need health care, especially of intensive care.

sourceString: On 31 December 2019, a cluster of pneumonia cases of unknown aetiology was reported in Wuhan, Hubei Province, China.
targetString: 31 दिसंबर 2019 को अज्ञात व्याधिनिदान-विज्ञान वाले निमोनिया मामलों के समूह को वुहान, हुबेई प्रांत, चीन में सूचित किया गया।
en-mt: On 31st December 2019, a cluster of pneumonia cases with unknown epidemiology was reported in Wuhan, Hubei Province, China.

sourceString: On 9 January 2020, the China Center for Disease Control and Prevention reported the causative agent as being a novel coronavirus now referred to as severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
targetString: 9 जनवरी 2020 को रोग नियंत्रण एवं रोकथाम केंद्र, चीन ने नोवेल कोरोनावायरस, जिसे अब गंभीर तीव्र श्वसन सिंड्रोम कोरोनावायरस 2 (SARS-CoV-2) के रूप में संदर्भित किया जाता है को रोगकारक के रूप में सूचित किया।
en-mt: On 9th January 2020, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, China reported the novel coronavirus, now referred to as severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2), as a pathogen.

sourceString: Since, the illness resulting from SARS-CoV-2 infection has been named coronavirus disease (COVID-19).
targetString: तब से, SARS-CoV-2 संक्रमण द्वारा उत्पन्न बीमारी का नाम कोरोनावायरस रोग (COVID-19) रखा गया है।
en-mt: Since then, the disease caused by SARS-CoV-2 infection has been named coronavirus disease (COVID-19).

sourceString: Evidence to date is that ca 80% of individuals with COVID-19 have a mild disease, i.e. a respiratory tract infection with or without pneumonia, and most of these recover.
targetString: आज तक का प्रमाण यह है कि COVID-19 वाले 80% व्यक्तियों में हल्का रोग होता है, यानी निमोनिया के साथ या बिना निमोनिया के श्वसन मार्ग संक्रमण और इनमें से अधिकतर ठीक हो जाते हैं।
en-mt: The evidence to date is that 80% of individuals with COVID-19 have mild disease, i.e. respiratory tract infections with or without pneumonia and most of these are cured.

sourceString: In ca 14% cases, COVID-19 develops into a more severe disease requiring hospitalisation while the remaining 6% cases experience critical illness requiring intensive care.
targetString: 14% मामलों में, COVID-19 अस्पताल में भर्ती होने की आवश्यकता वाले अधिक गंभीर रोग के रूप में विकसित हो जाता है जबकि बाकी 6% मामलों में गंभीर देखभाल की आवश्यकता वाली विकट बीमारी का अवलोकन होता है।
en-mt: In 14% of cases, COVID-19 develops into a more severe disease requiring hospitalization while the remaining 6% of cases have an overview of severe disease requiring critical care.

sourceString: The mortality of patients hospitalised due to COVID-19 is ca 4%.
targetString: COVID-19 के कारण अस्पताल में भर्ती हुए रोगियों की मृत्यु दर ca 4% है।
en-mt: The mortality rate of patients hospitalised due to COVID-19 is CA 4%.

sourceString: In this study, we assess the trends in the cumulative incidence of COVID-19 in each European Union/European Economic Area (EU/EEA) country and the United Kingdom (UK) and compare them to that of Hubei Province, China.
targetString: इस अध्ययन में, हम यूरोपीय संघ / यूरोपीय आर्थिक क्षेत्र (EU/EEA) के प्रत्येक देश और यूनाइटेड किंगडम (UK) में COVID-19 की संचयी व्यापकता की प्रवृत्ति का आकलन करते हैं और उसकी हुबेई प्रांत, चीन से तुलना करते हैं।
en-mt: In this study, we looked at the EU/EU regions. Assess the trend of cumulative prevalence of COVID-19 in each country in the European Economic Area (EU/EEA) and the United Kingdom (UK) and compare it with Hubei Province, China.

sourceString: We also compare the current number of COVID-19 cases in EU/EEA countries and the UK with that in Italy during 31 January–15 March 2020.
targetString: हम 31 जनवरी - 15 मार्च 2020 के दौरान EU/EEA देशों और UK में COVID-19 के मामलों की वर्तमान संख्या की इटली से तुलना भी करते हैं।
en-mt: We also compare the current number of COVID-19 cases in EU/EEA countries and the UK during 31 January – 15 March 2020 with that of Italy.

sourceString: COVID-19 cases in EU/EEA countries and the UK
targetString: EU/EEA देशों और UK में COVID-19 के मामले
en-mt: COVID-19 cases in EU/EEA countries and the UK

sourceString: Subsequent to China, COVID-19 underwent further geographical spread and the dynamic of the COVID-19 pandemic in the rest of the world currently follows that of this country.
targetString: चीन के बाद, COVID-19 का आगे भौगोलिक विस्तार हुआ और वर्तमान में COVID-19 महामारी की विश्व के बाकी देशों में क्रियाशीलता इसी देश से आगे बढ़ी।
en-mt: After China, COVID-19 underwent further geographical expansion and currently the covid-19 pandemic has expanded beyond this country in the rest of the world.

sourceString: On 11 March 2020, the Director General of the World Health Organization (WHO) declared COVID-19 a pandemic.
targetString: 11 मार्च 2020 को, विश्व स्वास्थ संगठन (WHO) के महानिदेशक ने COVID-19 को महामारी घोषित किया।
en-mt: On 11th March 2020, The Director-General of the World Health Organization (WHO) declared COVID-19 a pandemic.

sourceString: In the 5 March issue of Eurosurveillance 2020, Spiteri et al. reported on the first European confirmed COVID-19 cases according to the WHO case definition.
targetString: यूरोसर्विलांस 2020 के 5 मार्च के संस्करण, Spiteri et al. में WHO मामला परिभाषा के अनुसार पहले यूरोपीय पुष्टीकृत COVID-19 मामलों की सूचना दी गई।
en-mt: The 5 March edition of Eurosurveillance 2020, Spiteri et al., reported the first European confirmed COVID-19 cases by WHO case definition.

sourceString: In the EU/EEA, the first three confirmed cases were reported by France on 24 January 2020 in persons returning from Wuhan, Hubei Province, China.
targetString: EU/EEA में, फ्रांस द्वारा 24 जनवरी 2020 को वुहान, हुबेई प्रांत, चीन से लौट रहे लोगों में पहले तीन पुष्टीकृत मामलों को रिपोर्ट किया गया।
en-mt: In the EU/EEA, the first three confirmed cases in people returning from Wuhan, Hubei Province, China were reported by France on 24 January 2020.

sourceString: As at 15 March 2020, COVID-19 cases had been detected in all 30 EU/EEA countries and the United Kingdom (UK), whereby between 31 December 2019 and that date included, 39,768 cases and 1,727 deaths had been reported, with 17,750 cases and 1,441 deaths from Italy alone.
targetString: 15 मार्च 2020 तक, सभी 30 EU/EEA देशों और यूनाइटेड किंगडम (UK) में COVID-19 के मामले पाए गए, जिसमें केवल इटली से ही 17,750 मामले और 1,441 मृत्यु के साथ 31 दिसंबर 2019 और उस तिथि के बीच 39,768 मामले तथा 1,727 मृत्यु सूचित की गईं।
en-mt: As of 15 March 2020, covid-19 cases were detected in all 30 EU/EEA countries and the United Kingdom, with 17,750 cases and 1,441 deaths reported from Italy alone, with 39,768 cases and 1,727 deaths reported between 31 December 2019 and that date.

sourceString: Obtaining cumulative number and cumulative incidence of COVID-19 cases
targetString: COVID-19 मामलों की संचयी संख्या और संचयी व्यापकता प्राप्त करना
en-mt: Achieving the cumulative number and cumulative prevalence of COVID-19 cases

sourceString: At the European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC), the notified COVID-19 case counts in each country worldwide, obtained from only official sources such as the countries’ Ministry of Health, national and regional health authorities and the WHO, are updated each day at 8:00 a.m.
targetString: यूरोपीय रोग रोकथाम एवं नियंत्रण केंद्र (ECDC) में, केवल आधिकारिक स्रोत जैसे कि देशों के स्वास्थ्य मंत्रालय, राष्ट्रीय तथा क्षेत्रीय स्वास्थ्य प्राधिकरण तथा WHO से प्राप्त विश्व के प्रत्येक देश से सूचित COVID-19 मामलों की गणना हर दिन सुबह 8:00 बजे अद्यतित की जाती है।
en-mt: At the European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC), the count of reported COVID-19 cases from each country in the world, obtained only from official sources such as countries' ministries, national and regional health authorities, and the WHO, is updated every day at 8:00 a.m.

sourceString: These data were used for assessing the trends of COVID-19 in EU/EEA and the UK, and comparing them to that in Italy.
targetString: इन आंकड़ों का उपयोग EU/EEA और UK में COVID-19 की प्रवृत्ति का आकलन करने और उनकी तुलना इटली में हुये रोग से करने के लिए किया गया।
en-mt: These data were used to assess the trend of COVID-19 in the EU/EEA and the UK and compare them to the disease in Italy.

sourceString: As a proxy of the prevalence of active COVID-19 cases, we calculated the 14-day truncated cumulative incidence of COVID-19 cases, thus taking into account the natural course of COVID-19, in each EU/EEA country and the UK, during the 1 January–15 March 2020 period.
targetString: सक्रिय COVID-19 मामलों के प्रसार के प्रतिनिधि के रूप में, हमने इस प्रकार 1 जनवरी - 15 मार्च 2020 की अवधि के दौरान प्रत्येक EU/EEA देश और UK में COVID-19 के प्राकृतिक प्रक्रियाक्रम को ध्यान में रखते हुए COVID-19 मामलों की 14 दिन की संक्षिप्त संचयी व्यापकता की गणना की।
en-mt: As a representative of the spread of active COVID-19 cases, we thus calculated a 14-day brief cumulative prevalence of COVID-19 cases taking into account the natural course of COVID-19 in each EU/EEA country and the UK during the period 1 January – 15 March 2020.

sourceString: We also presented the cumulative number of notified cases of each country as at 15 March 2020 8:00 a.m. compared with that of Italy for the 31 January–15 March 2020 period.
targetString: हमने 31 जनवरी - 15 मार्च 2020 की अवधि में इटली की तुलना में 15 मार्च 2020 सुबह 8:00 बजे तक प्रत्येक देश में सूचित मामलों की संचयी संख्या भी प्रदर्शित की।
en-mt: We also displayed the cumulative number of reported cases in each country as of 8:00 a.m. on 15 March 2020 compared to Italy in the period 31 January – 15 March 2020.

sourceString: Trends of COVID-19 in EU/EEA countries and the UK
targetString: EU/EEA देशों और UK में COVID-19 की प्रवृत्ति
en-mt: COVID-19 trends in EU/EEA countries and the UK

sourceString: The trends in the 14-day truncated cumulative incidence of COVID-19 cases in EU/EEA countries and the UK generally followed that of Hubei Province (China) (Figure 1).
targetString: EU/EEA देशों और UK में COVID-19 मामलों की 14 दिन की संक्षिप्त संचयी व्यापकता की प्रवृत्ति सामान्यतः हुबेई प्रान्त (चीन) का अनुसरण करती है (चित्र 1)।
en-mt: The trend of a 14-day brief cumulative prevalence of COVID-19 cases in EU/EEA countries and the UK generally follows Hubei Province (China) (Figure 1).

sourceString: For the EU/EEA and the UK overall, the cumulative incidence of COVID-19 started to increase around 21 February and then increased sharply around 28 February 2020 (Supplementary material).
targetString: EU/EEA और सम्पूर्ण UK में, COVID-19 की समग्र संचयी व्यापकता 21 फरवरी के आसपासबढ़नी शुरू हुई और 28 फरवरी 2020 के आसपास तेजी से बढ़ी (अनुपूरक सामग्री)।
en-mt: Across the EU/EEA and the UK as a whole, the overall cumulative prevalence of COVID-19 began to increase around 21 February and increased rapidly around 28 February 2020 (Supplementary Material).

sourceString: This was mostly driven by the rapid increase in the number of reported cases from Italy, but all other EU/EEA countries and the UK showed similar increasing trends of the cumulative incidence of COVID-19 (Supplementary material).
targetString: यह मुख्य रूप से इटली से सूचित मामलों की संख्या में तीव्र वृद्धि के कारण थी, लेकिन अन्य सभी EU/EEA देशों और UK में COVID-19 की संचयी व्यापकता में वैसी ही बढ़ती हुयी प्रवृत्ति देखी गयी (अनुपूरक सामग्री)।
en-mt: This was mainly due to a sharp increase in the number of reported cases from Italy, but the cumulative prevalence of COVID-19 in all other EU/EEA countries and the UK showed a similar increasing trend (Supplementary Material).

sourceString: Figure 2 shows the cumulative number of COVID-19 cases, in EU/EEA countries and the UK compared with that in Italy for the 31 January–15 March 2020 period.
targetString: चित्र 2 EU/EEA देशों और UK में इटली की तुलना में COVID-19 मामलों की संचयी संख्या 31 जनवरी - 15 मार्च 2020 की अवधि में दिखाता है।
en-mt: Figure 2 shows the cumulative number of COVID-19 cases in EU/EEA countries and the UK compared to Italy over the period 31 January – 15 March 2020.

sourceString: It highlights that, as at 15 March 8:00 a.m., 15 other EU/EEA countries and the UK had already reported a total number of cases comparable to that of Italy just 3 weeks prior or less.
targetString: यह विशेष रूप से दर्शाता है कि 15 मार्च सुबह 8:00 बजे तक, 15 अन्य EU/EEA देशों और UK ने पहले ही केवल 3 सप्ताह पहले या कम समय में ही इटली के मामलों से तुलनीय मामलों की कुल संख्या सूचित कर दी थी।
en-mt: This highlights that as of 8:00 a.m. on 15 March, 15 other EU/EEA countries and the UK had already reported a total number of cases comparable to Italy's cases only 3 weeks ago or in a short period of time.

sourceString: Our results indicate that the number of notified cases of COVID-19 is rapidly increasing in the EU/EEA and the UK.
targetString: हमारे परिणाम इंगित करते हैं कि COVID-19 के सूचित मामलों की संख्या EU/EEA और UK में तेजी से बढ़ रही है।
en-mt: Our results indicate that the number of reported cases of COVID-19 is increasing rapidly in the EU/EEA and the UK.

sourceString: The observed trends in the cumulative incidence of COVID-19 suggest that the pandemic is progressing at a comparable speed in all countries.
targetString: COVID-19 की संचयी व्यापकता में देखी गयी प्रवृत्ति सुझाती है कि महामारी सभी देशों में तुलनात्मक गति के साथ बढ़ रही है।
en-mt: The observed trend in the cumulative prevalence of COVID-19 suggests that the pandemic is increasing with a comparable pace across all countries.

sourceString: This is despite countries being at different stages, variations in national public health responses, and possibly different case definitions in countries and different protocols for selecting patients that must be tested for confirmation of COVID-19, including catch-up testing.
targetString: यह देशों के विभिन्न चरणों में होने, राष्ट्रीय सार्वजनिक स्वास्थ्य प्रतिक्रियाओं में भिन्नताओं और देशों में संभवतः भिन्न मामला परिभाषाओं तथा रोगियों को चुनने के लिए भिन्न प्रोटोकॉल के बावजूद है, जिनकी पकड़ कर जांच करने सहित COVID-19 की पुष्टीकरण के लिए आवश्यक रूप से जांच की जानी चाहिए।
en-mt: This is despite countries being at different stages, variations in national public health responses, and possibly different case definitions across countries and different protocols for selecting patients who must be screened for confirmation of COVID-19, including capture and testing.

sourceString: Early March 2020, doctors in the affected regions of Italy described a situation in which ca 10% of patients with COVID-19 required intensive care and media sources reported that hospitals and intensive care units in these regions had already reached their maximum capacity.
targetString: मार्च 2020 की शुरुआत में, इटली के प्रभावित क्षेत्रों में चिकित्सकों ने ऐसी स्थिति के बारे में बताया जिसमें COVID-19 के 10% रोगियों को गहन देखभाल की आवश्यकता थी और मीडिया स्रोतों ने सूचित किया कि इन क्षेत्रों में अस्पताल तथा गहन देखभाल इकाइयाँ पहले ही अपनी अधिकतम क्षमता तक पहुंच गए हैं।
en-mt: In early March 2020, physicians in the affected areas of Italy reported a situation in which 10% of COVID-19 patients required intensive care and media sources reported that hospitals and intensive care units in these areas had already reached their maximum capacity.

sourceString: Data on admission of COVID-19 cases in a hospital and/or an intensive care unit are currently available at EU/EEA level for only 6% and 1% cases, respectively (data not shown).
targetString: COVID-19 मामलों के अस्पताल और/या गहन देखभाल इकाई में भर्ती होने के आंकड़े वर्तमान में केवल क्रमशः 6% और 1% मामलों के लिए EU/EEA स्तर पर उपलब्ध हैं (आंकड़े नहीं दिखाए गए)।
en-mt: Data on hospital and/or intensive care unit admissions of COVID-19 cases are currently only available at the EU/EEA level for 6% and 1% of cases, respectively (figures not shown).

sourceString: They should, however, be collected in a systematic fashion to complement current surveillance data that focus on the number of reported cases and the number of deaths.
targetString: उन्हें हालाँकि वर्तमान निगरानी आंकड़ों को अनुपूरित करने के लिए पद्यतिबद्ध तरीके से एकत्र किया जाना चाहिए जो सूचित मामलों की संख्या और मृत्यु की संख्या पर ध्यान केंद्रित करते हैं।
en-mt: They should however be collected in a methodical manner to supplement current surveillance data that focus on the number of reported cases and the number of deaths.

sourceString: A study performed in 2010–11 showed a large variation in the availability of intensive care and intermediate care beds in Europe, ranging from 29.2 in Germany to 4.2 beds per 100,000 population in Portugal.
targetString: 2010-11 में हुए अध्ययन में यूरोप में गहन देखभाल तथा मध्यवर्ती देखभाल बिस्तरों की उपलब्धता में प्रति 100,000 जनसंख्या पर जर्मनी में 29.2 से लेकर पुर्तगाल में 4.2 बिस्तरों तक का बड़ा अंतर देखा गया।
en-mt: The 2010-11 study found a large difference in the availability of intensive care and intermediate care beds in Europe from 29.2 beds per 100,000 population in Germany to 4.2 beds in Portugal.

sourceString: This means that countries may have more or less resources than Italy (12.5 intensive care and intermediate care beds per 100,000 population in 2010–11).
targetString: इसका अर्थ यह है कि देशों के पास इटली की अपेक्षा अधिक या कम संसाधन हो सकते हैं (2010-11 में प्रति 100,000 जनसंख्या पर 12.5 गहन देखभाल और मध्यवर्ती देखभाल बिस्तर)।
en-mt: This means that countries may have more or less resources than Italy (12.5 intensive care and intermediate care beds per 100,000 population in 2010-11).

sourceString: Modelling scenarios related to healthcare capacity saturation, with estimates for each EU/EEA country and the UK of the prevalence of hospitalised COVID-19 cases associated with a > 90% risk of exceeding intensive care bed capacity, are provided in the sixth update of the ECDC rapid risk assessment on COVID-19.
targetString: गहन देखभाल बिस्तर क्षमता के > 90% जोखिम से संबंधित अस्पताल में भर्ती COVID-19 मामलों का प्रसार हर EU/EEA देश और UK के लिए अनुमानों के साथ स्वास्थ्य देखभाल क्षमता संतृप्ति से संबंधित दशाओं का प्रतिरूपण COVID-19 पर ECDC के तीव्र जोखिम आकलन के छठे अद्यतन में प्रदान किया गया है।
en-mt: The prevalence >of hospitalizations related to 90% risk of intensive care bed capacity is provided in the sixth update of the ECDC's Acute Risk Assessment on COVID-19 with projections for every EU/EEA country and UK.

sourceString: Since cases have so far clustered in certain regions in EU/EEA countries and the UK, and hospitals and intensive care units usually serve a defined regional catchment population, information about cases and intensive care beds should preferably be made available at the Nomenclature of territorial units for statistics 2 (NUTS-2) level.
targetString: चूंकि अभी तक मामले EU/EEA देशों और UK के कुछ क्षेत्रों में झुंड में बने हुए हैं और अस्पताल तथा गहन देखभाल इकाइयाँ सामान्यतः परिभाषित क्षेत्रीय जनता को सेवाएं देते हैं, मामलों और गहन देखभाल बिस्तरों के बारे में जानकारी प्राथमिक तौर पर नोमेनक्लेच्योर ऑफ टेरिटोरियल यूनिट फॉर स्टैटिसटिक्स 2 (NUTS-2) स्तर पर उपलब्ध कराई जानी चाहिए।
en-mt: As cases still persist in flocks in EU/EEA countries and some regions of the UK, and hospitals and intensive care units serve a commonly defined regional population, information on cases and intensive care beds should be made available primarily at the nomenclature of Territorial Unit for Statistics 2 (NUTS-2) level.

sourceString: The experience from Italy and the current trends in other countries show that the COVID-19 pandemic is progressing rapidly in the EU/EEA and the UK.
targetString: इटली से प्राप्त अनुभव और अन्य देशों में वर्तमान प्रवृत्ति दिखाती है कि COVID-19 महामारी EU/EEA और UK में तेजी से बढ़ रही है।
en-mt: Experience gained from Italy and current trends in other countries show that the COVID-19 pandemic is accelerating in the EU/EEA and the UK.

sourceString: Countries, hospitals and intensive care units should thus prepare themselves for a scenario of sustained community transmission of SARS-CoV-2 and an increase in the number of patients with COVID-19 requiring healthcare, and in particular intensive care, such as the one occurring in the affected regions of Italy.
targetString: देशों, अस्पतालों और गहन देखभालइकाईयों को इस प्रकार SARS-CoV-2 के निरंतर सामुदायिक प्रसारण की स्थिति और स्वास्थ्य देखभाल, विशेष रुप से गहन देखभाल जैसा की इटली के प्रभावित क्षेत्रों में हो रहा है, की आवश्यकता वाले COVID-19 के रोगियों की संख्या में बढ़ोतरी के लिए स्वयं को तैयार करना चाहिए।
en-mt: Countries, hospitals and intensive care units should thus prepare themselves for the state of continued community transmission of SARS-CoV-2 and the increase in the number of COVID-19 patients requiring health care, especially intensive care, as is happening in the affected areas of Italy.

sourceString: As pointed out in the recent ECDC rapid risk assessment, a rapid, proactive and comprehensive approach is essential to delay the spread of SARS-COV-2, with a shift from a containment to a mitigation approach, as the anticipated rapid increase in the number of cases may not provide decision makers and hospitals enough time to comprehend, accept and adapt their response accordingly if not implemented ahead of time.
targetString: जैसा की हालिया ECDC के तीव्र जोखिम आकलन में इंगित किया गया, सीमित करने से शमन करने के दृष्टिकोण परिवर्तन के साथ, SARS-CoV-2 के प्रसार को धीमा करने के लिए तेज, अग्रसक्रिय और व्यापक दृष्टिकोण की आवश्यकता है, क्योंकि यदि समय रहते कार्यान्वित न किया गया, तो हो सकता है कि मामलों की संख्या में प्रत्याशित तेज वृद्धि निर्णयकर्ताओं तथा अस्पतालों को समझने, स्वीकार करने और तदनुसार अपनी प्रतिक्रिया को अनुकूलित करने का पर्याप्त समय प्रदान न करें।
en-mt: As pointed out in the recent ECDC's Acute Risk Assessment, with the shift from limiting to mitigation, a rapid, proactive and comprehensive approach is needed to slow the spread of SARS-CoV-2, because if not implemented in time, the anticipated sharp increase in the number of cases may lead to a sharp increase in the number of cases for decision-makers and hospitals to understand,  Don't provide enough time to accept and adapt your response accordingly.

sourceString: The rapid risk assessment also lists the public health measures to mitigate the impact of the pandemic.
targetString: तीव्र जोखिम आकलन महामारी के प्रभाव को दूर करने में सार्वजनिक स्वास्थ्य उपायों को सूचीबद्ध भी करता है।
en-mt: The acute risk assessment also lists public health measures in addressing the impact of the pandemic.

sourceString: There is a short window of opportunity during which countries have the possibility to further increase their control efforts to slow down the spread of SARS-CoV-2 and decrease the pressure on healthcare.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 के प्रसार को धीमा करने के लिए देशों के पास अपने नियंत्रण प्रयासों को और बढ़ाने और स्वास्थ्य देखभाल पर दबाव को कम करने के बहुत कम अवसर हैं।
en-mt: Countries have little opportunity to further step up their control efforts and ease pressure on health care to slow the spread of SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Failing this, it is likely that the healthcare systems of other EU/EEA countries will face a surge of patients that require intensive care within the coming days or weeks.
targetString: इसमें असफल होने पर, इसकी बहुत संभावना है कि अन्य EU/EEA देशों की स्वास्थ्य देखभाल व्यवस्थाओं को आने वाले दिनों या सप्ताहों में गहन देखभाल की आवश्यकता वाले रोगियों में तेजी से बढ़ोतरी का सामना करना पड़े।
en-mt: Failing this, it is very likely that the health care systems of other EU/EEA countries will face a rapid increase in patients requiring intensive care in the coming days or weeks.

sourceString: The outbreak of Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2), has thus far killed over 3,000 people and infected over 80,000 in China and elsewhere in the world, resulting in catastrophe for humans.
targetString: गंभीर तीव्र श्वसन सिंड्रोम (SARS) कोरोनावायरस 2 (SARS-CoV-2) के कारण कोरोनावायरस रोग 2019 (COVID-19) के प्रकोप से अभी तक 3,000 से अधिक लोगों की मृत्यु हो गई है और चीन और विश्व में अन्यत्र 80,000 से अधिक लोग संक्रमित हो गए हैं, जिसके परिणामस्वरूप मनुष्यों के लिए आपदा उत्पन्न हो गई है।
en-mt: The outbreak of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS-CoV-2) has so far killed more than 3,000 people and infected more than 80,000 people in China and elsewhere in the world, resulting in a disaster for humans.

sourceString: Similar to its homologous virus, SARS-CoV, which caused SARS in thousands of people in 2003, SARS-CoV-2 might also be transmitted from the bats and causes similar symptoms through a similar mechanism.
targetString: अपने सजातीय वायरस SARS-CoV की तरह, जिसके कारण 2003 में हजारों लोगों में SARS हुआ, SARS-CoV-2 भी चमगादड़ों से संचारित हुआ हो सकता है और सामान क्रियाविधि द्वारा समान लक्षण उत्पन्न करता है।
en-mt: Like its homogeneous virus SARS-CoV, which caused SARS to thousands of people in 2003, SARS-CoV-2 may have been transmitted from bats and produced similar symptoms by similar mechanisms.

sourceString: However, COVID-19 has lower severity and mortality than SARS but is much more transmissive and affects more elderly individuals than youth and more men than women.
targetString: हालांकि, COVID-19 की SARS की अपेक्षा निम्न गंभीरता एवं मृत्यु दर है, परंतु बहुत अधिक संचरणशील है तथा युवाओं की अपेक्षा बुजुर्ग लोगों और महिलाओं की अपेक्षा पुरुषों को अधिक प्रभावित करता है।
en-mt: Although COVID-19 has a lower severity and mortality rate than SARS, it is highly transmissible and affects older people than young people and more men than women.

sourceString: In response to the rapidly increasing number of publications on the emerging disease, this article attempts to provide a timely and comprehensive review of the swiftly developing research subject.
targetString: उभरते रोग पर तेजी से बढ़ रही प्रकाशनों की संख्या के प्रत्युत्तर में, यह लेख तेजी से विकसित हो रहे शोध विषय पर सामयिक तथा व्यापक समीक्षा प्रदान करने का प्रयास करता है।
en-mt: In response to the rapidly growing number of publications on emerging disease, this article attempts to provide a timely and comprehensive review of a rapidly evolving research topic.

sourceString: We will cover the basics about the epidemiology, etiology, virology, diagnosis, treatment, prognosis, and prevention of the disease.
targetString: हम रोग के महामारी-विज्ञान, हेतु-विज्ञान, विषाणु-विज्ञान, निदान, उपचार, पूर्वानुमान तथा रोकथाम पर मूलभूत चीजों को शामिल करेंगे।
en-mt: We will cover the basics on epidemiology, epidemiology, virology, diagnosis, treatment, prognosis and prevention of disease.

sourceString: Although many questions still require answers, we hope that this review helps in the understanding and eradication of the threatening disease.
targetString: हालांकि अभी भी बहुत सारे प्रश्नों के उत्तर ढूंढने हैं, हमें आशा है कि यह समीक्षा घातक रोग को समझने और उसके उन्मूलन में सहायता करेगी।
en-mt: While there are still a lot of questions to find answers to, we hope this review will aid in understanding and eradicating the deadly disease.

sourceString: The Spring Festival on January 25, 2020 has become an unprecedented and unforgettable memory to all Chinese who were urged to stay indoors for all the holiday and for many weeks after due to the outbreak of a novel viral disease.
targetString: नोवेल वायरल रोग के प्रकोप के कारण 25 जनवरी, 2020 को वसंतोत्सव सभी चीनी लोगों, जिन्हें पूरे अवकाश और उसके बाद कई सप्ताह तक घर में रहने के लिए अनुरोध किया गया, उनके लिए अप्रत्याशित तथा भुलायी न जा सकने वाली स्मृति बन गया है।
en-mt: Due to the outbreak of the novel viral disease, the spring festival on January 25, 2020, has become an unexpected and unforgettable memory for all Chinese people who were requested to stay at home for the entire holiday and several weeks thereafter.

sourceString: The virus is highly homologous to the coronavirus (CoV) that caused an outbreak of severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) in 2003; thus, it was named SARS-CoV-2 by the World Health Organization (WHO) on February 11, 2020, and the associated disease was named CoV Disease-19 (COVID-19).
targetString: वायरस, कोरोनावायरस (CoV) के बहुत अधिक समान है जिसके कारण 2003 में अति तीव्र श्वसन सिंड्रोम (SARS) का प्रकोप हुआ; इसलिए, फरवरी 11, 2020 को विश्व स्वास्थ्य संगठन (WHO) द्वारा इसका नाम SARS-CoV-2 रखा गया और संबंधित रोग का नाम CoV Disease-19 (COVID-19) रखा गया।
en-mt: The virus is very similar to the coronavirus (CoV) that led to the outbreak of Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS) in 2003; Therefore, on February 11, 2020, it was named SARS-CoV-2 by the World Health Organization (WHO) and the related disease was named CoV Disease-19.

sourceString: The epidemic started in Wuhan, China, and quickly spread throughout the entire country and to near 50 others all over the world.
targetString: महामारी वुहान, चीन से शुरू हुई और तेजी से पूरे देश और विश्व के लगभग 50 अन्य देशों में फैल गई।
en-mt: The epidemic started from Wuhan, China and rapidly spread to the whole country and about 50 other countries of the world.

sourceString: As of March 2, 2020, the virus has resulted in over 80,000 confirmed cases of COVID-19, with more than 40,000 patients discharged and over 3,000 patients who died.
targetString: 2 मार्च 2020 तक, वायरस के कारण 40,000 रोगियों से अधिक की अस्पताल से छुट्टी और 3,000 से अधिक रोगियों की मृत्यु के साथ COVID-19 के 80,000 से अधिक पुष्टिकृत मामले हुए हैं।
en-mt: As of 2 March 2020, there have been more than 80,000 confirmed cases of COVID-19 with more than 40,000 patients discharged from hospital and over 3,000 patients dying due to the virus.

sourceString: WHO warns that COVID-19 is “public enemy number 1” and potentially more powerful than terrorism.
targetString: WHO ने चेतावनी दी है कि COVID-19 “जनता का दुश्मन नंबर 1” है और संभवतः आतंकवाद से अधिक शक्तिशाली है।
en-mt: The WHO has warned that COVID-19 is "the enemy no. 1 of the people" and possibly more powerful than terrorism.

sourceString: According to PubMed (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/), in less than two months, over 200 papers have been published on COVID-19 including its virology, epidemiology, etiology, diagnosis, and treatment since the first report on January 7, 2020 that determined the sequence of the virus isolated from multiple patients.
targetString: PubMed (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/) के अनुसार, 7 जनवरी 2020 को पहली रिपोर्ट के बाद दो महीने से भी कम समय में, विषाणु-विज्ञान, महामारी-विज्ञान, हेतु-विज्ञान, निदान, तथा उपचार सहित COVID-19 पर 200 से अधिक लेख्य प्रकाशित हो चुके हैं, जिससे कई रोगियों से पृथक करके वायरस का अनुक्रम निर्धारित हुआ।
en-mt: According to PubMed (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/), in less than two months since the first report on 7 January 2020, more than 200 articles on COVID-19, including virology, epidemiology, epidemiology, epidemiology, diagnostics, and treatment, have been published, isolating the sequence of viruses from many patients.

sourceString: This review attempts to summarize the research progress in the new and swiftly developing subject area.
targetString: यह समीक्षा नए तथा तेजी से विकसित हो रहे विषय क्षेत्र पर शोध प्रगति का सार प्रस्तुत करने का प्रयास करती है।
en-mt: This review attempts to summarize research progress on a new and rapidly evolving subject area.

sourceString: Whenever possible, we will try to compare COVID-19 with SARS and another CoV-caused disease, Middle East respiratory syndrome (MERS, an outbreak in 2012).
targetString: जब भी संभव होगा, हम COVID-19 की SARS तथा CoV के कारण होने वाले अन्य रोग, मध्य पूर्व श्वसन सिंड्रोम (MERS, 2012 में प्रकोप) से तुलना करने का प्रयास करेंगे।
en-mt: Whenever possible, we will try to compare COVID-19 with SARS and other diseases caused by CoV, Middle East Respiratory Syndrome (outbreak in MERS, 2012).

sourceString: We will also discuss what we have learned so far regarding the prevention and prognosis of the disease as well as some remaining yet urgent questions.
targetString: हम रोग की रोकथाम तथा पूर्वानुमान के साथ ही साथ कुछ बाकी फिर भी अति आवश्यक प्रश्नों के संबंध में हमने अभी तक जो सीखा है उस पर चर्चा भी करेंगे।
en-mt: We will also discuss what we have learned so far with regard to disease prevention and prognosis, as well as some other yet urgent questions.

sourceString: CoVs have been traditionally considered nonlethal pathogens to humans, mainly causing approximately 15% of common colds 4.
targetString: CoVs मुख्य रूप से आम सर्दी 4 का लगभग 15% जुकाम उत्पन्न करने के साथ पारंपरिक रूप से मनुष्यों के लिए गैर-घातक रोगजनक माने गए हैं।
en-mt: CoVs has traditionally been considered a non-lethal pathogen to humans, with the common cold producing about 15% of the common cold4.

sourceString: However, in this century, we have encountered highly pathogenic human CoVs twice, i.e., SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, which caused an outbreak originally in China in 2003 and Saudi Arabia in 2012, respectively, and soon spread to many other countries with horrible morbidity and mortality.
targetString: हालांकि, इस शताब्दी में हमने दो बार अत्यधिक रोगजनक मानव CoVs का सामना किया है, यानी, SARS-CoV और MERS-CoV, जिनके कारण मूल रूप से क्रमशः 2003 में चीन में और 2012 में सऊदी अरब में प्रकोप देखा गया और शीघ्र ही भयानक अस्वस्थता और मृत्यु दर के साथ कई अन्य देशों में फैल गया।
en-mt: However, in this century we have twice encountered highly pathogenic human CoVs, i.e., SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, which originally caused outbreaks in China in 2003 and in Saudi Arabia in 2012, respectively, and soon spread to many other countries with terrible morbidity and mortality.

sourceString: Therefore, the current COVID-19 is the third CoV outbreak in the recorded history of humans.
targetString: इस प्रकार, वर्तमान COVID-19 मनुष्यों के अभिलेखित इतिहास में तीसरा CoV प्रकोप है।
en-mt: Thus, the current COVID-19 is the third CoV outbreak in the recorded history of humans.

sourceString: As shown in Fig. ​Fig.1,1, clusters of pneumonia that had unknown origins were first reported from Wuhan on December 31, 2019 to the China National Health Commission.
targetString: जैसा चित्र चित्र 1,1 में दिखाया गया है, निमोनिया के झुंड, जिनका मूल अज्ञात था, पहली बार दिसंबर 31, 2019 को वुहान से चीनी राष्ट्रीय स्वास्थ्य आयोग को सूचित किए गये।
en-mt: As shown in Figure 1,1, the pneumonia flocks, whose origin was unknown, were first reported to the Chinese National Health Commission from Wuhan on December 31, 2019.

sourceString: Seven days later the sequence of the CoV was released.
targetString: सात दिन बाद CoV का अनुक्रम जारी किया गया।
en-mt: Seven days later the CoV sequence was released.

sourceString: On January 15, 2020 the first fatal case from Wuhan was reported.
targetString: 15 जनवरी 2020 को वुहान से पहला घातक मामला सूचित किया गया।
en-mt: The first fatal case was reported from Wuhan on 15 January 2020.

sourceString: Meanwhile, the epidemic rapidly spread to the neighboring cities, provinces, and countries.
targetString: इस दौरान, महामारी तेजी से निकटवर्ती शहरों, प्रांतों और देशों में फैल गई।
en-mt: During this time, the epidemic rapidly spread to nearby cities, provinces, and countries.

sourceString: On January 20, the infection of health-care providers was reported, suggesting that human-to-human transmission was possible.
targetString: 20 जनवरी को, स्वास्थ्य देखभाल प्रदाताओं में संक्रमण की सूचना मिली, जिसने यह संकेत दिए कि मानव से मानव संचरण संभव था।
en-mt: On January 20, infections were reported in health care providers, which indicated that human-to-human transmission was possible.

sourceString: On January 23, the city of Wuhan was locked down with all its public transportation stopped.
targetString: 23 जनवरी को, इसके सभी सार्वजनिक यातायात बंद करने के साथ वुहान शहर को लॉकडाउन कर दिया गया।
en-mt: On January 23, the city of Wuhan was locked down with the closure of all its public traffic.

sourceString: On January 24 the first clinical study on the disease reported that, out of 41 patients with confirmed cases, only 21 had direct contact with the Wuhan seafood market that was considered the starting site of the infection from an unknown animal source.
targetString: 24 जनवरी को रोग पर पहले नैदानिक अध्ययन में सूचित किया गया कि पुष्टिकृत मामलों वाले 41 रोगियों में से केवल 21 का वुहान के समुद्री भोजन बाजार से प्रत्यक्ष संपर्क था, जिसे किसी अज्ञात जंतु स्रोत से संक्रमण का आरंभ स्थल माना जाता था।
en-mt: On January 24, the first clinical study on the disease reported that only 21 of the 41 patients with confirmed cases had direct contact with the seafood market in Wuhan, which was believed to be the starting point of infection from an unknown animal source.

sourceString: On January 30, WHO declared the outbreak a global health emergency.
targetString: 30 जनवरी को WHO ने प्रकोप को वैश्विक स्वास्थ्य आपदा घोषित किया।
en-mt: On January 30, the WHO declared the outbreak a global health disaster.

sourceString: By the time of this report, the disease has already spread throughout China and near 50 other countries all over the world (Fig. ​(Fig.2).2).
targetString: इस रिपोर्ट के समय तक, रोग पहले ही पूरे चीन और विश्व के लगभग 50 अन्य देशों में फैल चुका है (चित्र (चित्र 2).2)।
en-mt: By the time of this report, the disease had already spread throughout China and about 50 other countries around the world (Figure 2).2).

sourceString: As the situation is rapidly evolving, the final scope and severity of the outbreak remain to be determined.
targetString: चूंकि स्थिति तेजी से बढ़ रही है, प्रकोप का अंतिम व्यापकता तथा तीव्रता का निर्धारण किया जाना बाकी है।
en-mt: As the situation is escalating rapidly, the final magnitude and intensity of the outbreak is yet to be determined.

sourceString: On February 11, 2020, a multi-center study on 8,866 patients including 4,021 confirmed COVID-19 patients presented a more updated illustration of the epidemic as follows (https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s/UlBi-HX_rHPXa1qHA2bhdA).
targetString: 11 फरवरी 2020 को 4,021 पुष्टिकृत COVID-19 रोगियों सहित 8,866 रोगियों के बहु-केंद्रीय अध्ययन में निम्न प्रकार से महामारी का अधिक अद्यतित चित्रण प्रस्तुत हुआ (https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s/UlBi-HX_rHPXa1qHA2bhdA)।
en-mt: A multi-centric study of 8,866 patients, including 4,021 confirmed COVID-19 patients, on 11 February 2020 presented a more up-to-date depiction of the pandemic as follows (https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s/UlBi-HX_rHPXa1qHA2bhdA).

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 infected people of all ages, but mainly at the age of 30-65.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 से सभी आयु के लोग संक्रमित हुए, परंतु मुख्य रूप से 30-65 वर्ष की आयु के।
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 infected people of all ages, but mainly those aged 30-65 years.

sourceString: Almost half (47.7%) of the infected individuals were over 50 years old, very few were under 20, and only 14 infected individuals were under the age of 10.
targetString: संक्रमित व्यक्तियों में से लगभग आधे (47.7%) 50 वर्ष से अधिक आयु के थे, बहुत कम 20 वर्ष से कम और केवल 14 संक्रमित व्यक्ति 10 वर्ष से कम आयु के थे।
en-mt: Nearly half (47.7%) of the infected persons were above 50 years of age, very few were under 20 years of age and only 14 infected persons were below 10 years of age.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 infected more men (0.31/100,000) than women (0.27/100,000).
en-mt: Men (0.31/100,000) were more infected with SARS-CoV-2 than women (0.27/100,000).

sourceString: COVID-19 expanded in clusters mainly in and around Hubei.
targetString: COVID-19 मुख्य रूप से हुबेई में और इसके आसपास झुंडों में फैला।
en-mt: COVID-19 mainly spread in flocks in and around Hubei.

sourceString: COVID-19 took an average of 5 (2-9) days from onset to diagnosis.
targetString: COVID-19 ने शुरुआत से निदान तक औसतन 5 (2-9) दिन लिये।
en-mt: COVID-19 took an average of 5 (2-9) days from onset to diagnosis.

sourceString: The average incubation period was 4.8 (3.0-7.2) days.
targetString: औसतन इन्क्यूबेशन अवधि 4.8 (3.0-7.2) दिन थी।
en-mt: The average incubation period was 4.8 (3.0-7.2) days.

sourceString: The average time from onset to death was 9.5 (4.8-13) days.
targetString: शुरुआत से मृत्यु तक औसतन समय 9.5 (4.8-13) दिन था।
en-mt: The average time from onset to death was 9.5 (4.8-13) days.

sourceString: The basic reproductive number (R0) was 3.77 (95% CI: 3.51-4.05), and the adjusted R0 was 2.23-4.82.
en-mt: The original reproduction number (R0) was 3.77 (95% CI:3.51-4.05), and the adjusted R0 was 2.23-4.82.

sourceString: The number of infected people increased exponentially before 23 Jan. 2020, matching the time of massive transportation before the Spring Festival in China.
targetString: 23 जनवरी 2020 से पहले संक्रमित लोगों की संख्या तेजी से बढ़ गई, जो चीन में वसंतोत्सव से पहले व्यापक यातायात से मेल खाती है।
en-mt: The number of infected people increased rapidly before 23 January 2020, which corresponds to the widespread traffic ahead of springfestival in China.

sourceString: The mortality of patients with confirmed cases was 1.44% (95% CI: 1.10-1.86%), and the adjusted mortality of all the patients was 3.06% (95% CI: 2.02-4.59%).
en-mt: The mortality rate of patients with confirmed cases was 1.44% (95% CI: 1.10-1.86%) and the adjusted mortality rate of all patients was 3.06% (95% CI: 2.02-4.59%).

sourceString: Three major risk factors for COVID-19 were sex (male), age (≥60), and severe pneumonia.
targetString: COVID-19 के तीन प्रमुख जोखिम कारक लिंग (पुरुष), आयु (≥60), और गंभीर निमोनिया थे।
en-mt: The three major risk factors for COVID-19 were gender (male), age (≥60), and severe pneumonia.

sourceString: CoVs are a subfamily of large and enveloped viruses containing a single strand of sense RNA.
targetString: CoVs, RNA के एकल लड़ी वाले बड़े और आवरित वायरसों का उप-परिवार है।
en-mt: CoVs is a subfamily of large and enveloped viruses with a single strand of RNA.

sourceString: They can be divided into four genera, i.e., alpha, beta, gamma, and delta, of which alpha- and beta-CoVs are known to infect humans.
targetString: उन्हें चार पीढ़ियों में बाँटा जा सकता है, यानी, अल्फा, बीटा, गामा और डेल्टा जिनमें से अल्फा और बीटा-CoVs मानव को संक्रमित करने के रूप में जाने जाते हैं।
en-mt: They can be divided into four generations, i.e., alpha, beta, gamma and delta of which alpha and beta-CoVs are known to infect humans.

sourceString: The envelope spike (S) glycoprotein binds to its cellular receptors angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) and dipeptidyl peptidase 4 (DPP4) for SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, respectively, and then membrane fusion occurs.
targetString: आवरण नोक (S) ग्लाइकोप्रोटीन, SARS-CoV और MERS-CoV में क्रमशः इसके कोशिकीय प्रापक एन्जियोटेंसिन-परिवर्तनकारी एंजाइम 2 (ACE2) और डाईपेप्टिडाइल पेप्टिडेज 4 (DPP4) से जुड़ती है और फिर झिल्ली का विलय होता है।
en-mt: The envelope tip(S) glycoproteins, SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, bind to its cellular promoter angiotensin-transforming enzyme 2 (ACE2) and dipeptidyl peptidase 4 (DPP4), respectively, and then merge the membrane.

sourceString: The viral RNA genome is released into the cytoplasm; after replication of the viral genome, genomic RNA accompanied by envelope glycoproteins and nucleocapsid proteins forms virion-containing vesicles, which then fuse with the plasma membrane to release the virus.
targetString: वायरल RNA जीनोम कोशिकीय द्रव्य में निर्मुक्त हो जाता है; वायरल जीनोम की प्रतिकृति के बाद, आवरण ग्लाइकोप्रोटीनों और न्यूक्लियोकैप्सिड प्रोटीनों के साथ जीनोमीक RNA विरियन वाली पुटिकाएँ बनाता है, जिसका बाद में वायरस की निर्मुक्ति के लिए प्लाज्मा झिल्ली में विलय हो जाता है।
en-mt: The viral RNA genome is released into the extracellular fluid; After replication of the viral genome, the envelope forms vesicles containing genomic RNA virions with glycoproteins and nucleocapsid proteins, which are then merged into the plasma membrane for release of the virus.

sourceString: The first genomic sequence of SARS-CoV-2 was reported on January 10, 2020.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 का पहला जीनोमीक अनुक्रम 10 जनवरी 2020 को सूचित किया गया था।
en-mt: The first genomic sequence of SARS-CoV-2 was reported on 10 January 2020.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 was found to be a new type of beta-CoV with more than 99.98% genetic identity among 10 sequenced samples collected from the original site of the outbreak, the Huanan Seafood Market in Wuhan.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 को बीटा-CoV का नया प्रकार पाया गया जिसमें प्रकोप के मूल स्थान वुहान के हुआनन समुद्री भोजन बाजार से एकत्रित 10 अनुक्रमित नमूनों में 99.98% से अधिक आनुवंशिक समानता पायी गयी।
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 was found to be a new variant of beta-CoV, with genetic similarity of more than 99.98% in 10 sequenced samples collected from the Huanan seafood market in Wuhan, the origin of the outbreak.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 is genetically more similar to SARS-CoV than to MERS-CoV.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 आनुवंशिक रूप से MERS-CoV की अपेक्षा SARS-CoV के अधिक समान है।
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 is genetically more similar to SARS-CoV than MERS-CoV.

sourceString: Through transmission electron microscopy, SARS-CoV-2 particles were found in ultrathin sections of human airway epithelium.
targetString: संचरण इलेक्ट्रॉन सूक्ष्मदर्शन द्वारा, SARS-CoV-2 कण मानव वायुमार्ग उपकला के अति-महीन खंडों में पायी गयी।
en-mt: By transmission electron microscopy, SARS-CoV-2 particles were detected in ultrafine segments of the human airway epithelium.

sourceString: Human ACE2 was found to be a receptor for SARS-CoV-2 as well as SARS-CoV.
targetString: मानव ACE2, SARS-CoV-2 के साथ साथ SARS-CoV के लिए प्रापक पाया गया।
en-mt: Human ACE2 was found to be compatible with SARS-CoV-2 as well as SARS-CoV.

sourceString: However, the S protein of SARS-CoV-2 binds to human ACE2 more weakly than that of SARS-CoV, which is coincident with the fact that SARS-CoV-2 causes less severe infection in patients than SARS-CoV.
targetString: हालांकि, SARS-CoV-2 का S प्रोटीन SARS-CoV की अपेक्षा अधिक कमजोरी के साथ मानव ACE2 से जुड़ता है जो इस तथ्य के अनुरूप है कि SARS-CoV-2, रोगियों में SARS-CoV की अपेक्षा कम गंभीर संक्रमण उत्पन्न करता है।
en-mt: However, the S protein of SARS-CoV-2 binds to human ACE2 with greater weakness than SARS-CoV, which is consistent with the fact that SARS-CoV-2 produces less severe infections in patients than SARS-CoV.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 can also form a novel short protein encoded by orf3b and a secreted protein encoded by orf8.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2, orf3b द्वारा कोडित नोवेल लघु प्रोटीन और orf8 द्वारा कोडित स्रावित प्रोटीन भी बना सकता है।
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 can also form novel short proteins coded by orf3b and secreted proteins coded by orf8.

sourceString: The orf3b of SARS-CoV-2 may play a role in the viral pathogenicity and inhibit the expression of IFNβ; however, orf8 does not contain any known functional domain or motif.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 का orf3b वायरल रोगजनकता में भूमिका निभा सकता है और IFNβ की अभिव्यक्ति अवरोधित कर सकता है; हालांकि orf8 में कोई ज्ञात कार्यात्मक डोमेन या मोटिफ नहीं है।
en-mt: Orf3b of SARS-CoV-2 may play a role in viral pathogenicity and inhibit the expression of IFNbeta; However, orf8 has no known functional domain or motif.

sourceString: On February 18, 2020, Zhou, et al., reported the cryo-EM structure of the full-length human ACE2 at 2.9 Å resolution in complex with the amino acid transporter B0AT1.
targetString: 18 फरवरी 2020 को, Zhou, et al. ने अमीनो अम्ल परिवाहक B0AT1 के साथ मिश्रण में 2.9 Å रेजोल्यूशन पर पूर्ण लंबाई वाले मानव ACE2 की cryo-EM संरचना की सूचना दी।
en-mt: On 18 February 2020, Zhou, et al. reported the cryo-EM structure of full-length human ACE2 at 2.9 Å resolution in mixture with the amino acid transporter B0AT1.

sourceString: They found that the complex, which had open and closed conformations, was assembled as a dimer and the ACE2-B0AT1 complex can bind two S proteins, which provides evidence for CoV recognition and infection.
targetString: उन्होंने पाया कि मिश्रण, जिसमें मुक्त और बंद रचनाएं थीं, उसे डाइमर के रूप में संकलित किया गया था और ACE2-B0AT1 मिश्रण दो S प्रोटीन को जोड़ सकता है जो CoV की पहचान और संक्रमण के लिए साक्ष्य प्रदान करता है।
en-mt: They found that the mixture, which had free and closed compositions, was compiled as a dimer and that the ACE2-B0AT1 mixture could combine two S proteins providing evidence for the identification and infection of CoV.

sourceString: B0AT1 may become a therapeutic target for drug screening to suppress SARS-CoV-2 infection.
targetString: B0AT1, SARS-CoV-2 संक्रमण का दमन करने हेतु दवा जांच के लिए चिकित्सीय लक्ष्य बन सकता है।
en-mt: B0AT1 may become a therapeutic target for drug testing to suppress SARS-CoV-2 infection.

sourceString: The origin and intermediate host
targetString: मूल एवं मध्यवर्ती पोषक
en-mt: Basic and intermediate nutrients

sourceString: It has been known that both SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV originated from bats and were transmitted to humans via civet cats and camels, respectively.
targetString: यह ज्ञात है कि SARS-CoV और MERS-CoV दोनों चमगादड़ों से उत्पन्न हुए और मानवों में क्रमशः सिवेट बिल्ली और ऊंट द्वारा संचारित हुए।
en-mt: It is known that both SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV originated from bats and were transmitted to humans by civet cat and camel, respectively.

sourceString: Through a phylogenetic comparison of SARS-CoV-2 with other CoVs, bats were considered the native host of SARS-CoV-2 as the new virus is 96% identical to two SARS-like CoVs from bats called bat-SL-CoVZX45 and bat-SL-CoVZX21.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 की अन्य CoVs से जातिवृत्तीय तुलना के द्वारा, चमगादड़ को SARS-CoV-2 का मूल पोषक माना गया क्योंकि नया वायरस दो SARS-जैसे CoVs जिन्हें bat-SL-CoVZX45 और bat-SL-CoVZX21 कहा जाता है, उनसे 96% समान है।
en-mt: By methodological comparison of SARS-CoV-2 with other CoVs, bats were considered to be the basic nutrient of SARS-CoV-2 because the new virus is 96% identical to two SARS-like CoVs called bat-SL-CoVZX45 and bat-SL-CoVZX21.

sourceString: However, what intermediate host helped the virus cross the species barrier to infect humans remains unknown, and the transmission route is yet to be elucidated.
targetString: हालांकि, किस मध्यवर्ती पोषक ने वायरस की प्रजाति बाधा पार कर मानव को संक्रमित करने में सहायता की अज्ञात है और संचरण मार्ग अभी भी स्पष्ट किया जाना है।
en-mt: However, which intermediate nutrient assisted the virus in infecting humans by crossing the species barrier is unknown and the transmission route still remains to be elucidated.

sourceString: Ji, et al., proposed snakes as a carrier of the virus from bats to humans which involved homologous recombination within the S protein.
targetString: Ji, et al., ने सांप को चमगादड़ से मानव में वायरस के संवाहक के रूप में प्रस्तावित किया जिसमें S प्रोटीन के साथ समान पुनर्संयोजन शामिल था।
en-mt: Ji, et al., proposed the snake as a carrier of the virus from bats to human that involved similar recombination with the S protein.

sourceString: According to a study, researchers in Guangzhou, China, suggested that pangolins - long-snouted, ant-eating mammals often used in traditional Chinese medicine - are the potential intermediate host of SARS-CoV-2 based on 99% genetic homology in a CoV discovered in pangolins and SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: एक अध्ययन के अनुसार, ग्वांगझू, चीन में शोधकर्ताओं ने संकेत दिया कि पैंगोलिन - प्रायः पारंपरिक चीनी चिकित्सा में उपयोग होने वाला लंबी थूथन वाला, चींटी खाने वाला स्तनधारी SARS-CoV-2 और पैंगोलिन में पाए गए CoV में 99% आनुवंशिक समानता के आधार पर SARS-CoV-2 के संभावित मध्यवर्ती पोषक हैं।
en-mt: According to a study, researchers in Guangzhou, China, indicated that pangolins — often long-snouted, ant-eating mammals often used in traditional Chinese medicine — are potential intermediate nutrients to SARS-CoV-2 based on 99% genetic similarity in SARS-CoV-2 and CoV found in pangolins.

sourceString: However, 1% difference spread all over two genomes is still a big difference; thus, conclusive results for concrete evidence are awaited (Fig. ​(Fig.33).
targetString: हालांकि, पूरे दोनों जीनोम में 1% के अंतर का प्रसार अभी भी बड़ा अंतर है; इसलिए, ठोस साक्ष्य के लिए निर्णायक परिणामों की प्रतीक्षा है (चित्र (चित्र 33)।
en-mt: However, the prevalence of a difference of 1% in the whole two genomes is still a large difference; Therefore, conclusive results are awaited for solid evidence (Figure 33).

sourceString: The physicochemical properties of SARS-CoV-2 are largely not yet known.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 के भौतिक गुण मुख्य रूप से अभी तक ज्ञात नहीं है।
en-mt: The physical properties of SARS-CoV-2 are mainly not yet known.

sourceString: SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV can survive in vitro for 48 hours in a dry environment and up to 5 days under 20 °C and 40%-50% humidity.
targetString: SARS-CoV और MERS-CoV कृत्रिम परिवेशीय शुष्क वातावरण में 48 घंटे और 20 °C से कम और 40%-50% आद्रता पर 5 दिन तक जीवित रह सकता है।
en-mt: SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV can survive in in vitro dry environments for 48 hours and up to 5 days at humidity of less than 20°C and 40%-50%.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 may possess similar properties.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 में समान गुण हो सकते हैं।
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 may have similar properties.

sourceString: It has been reported that SARS-CoV-2 is sensitive to ultraviolet rays and heat at 56 °C for 30 minutes; ether, 75% ethanol, chlorine-containing disinfectant, peracetic acid, chloroform, and other fatty solvents, but not chlorhexidine, can effectively inactivate the virus.
targetString: यह सूचित किया गया है कि SARS-CoV-2, 56 °C पर 30 मिनट के लिए और पराबैंगनी किरणों के प्रति संवेदनशील है; इथर, 75% इथेनॉल, क्लोरीन वाले कीटाणुनाशक, पेरासटिक अम्ल, क्लोरोफॉर्म तथा अन्य वसा विलायक प्रभावी रूप से वायरस को निष्क्रिय कर सकते हैं, लेकिन क्लोरहेक्सिडीन नहीं।
en-mt: It has been reported that SARS-CoV-2 is sensitive to ultraviolet rays for 30 minutes at 56°C; Ether, 75% ethanol, chlorine-containing disinfectants, parastatic acid, chloroform and other fat solvents can effectively inactivate the virus, but not chlorhexidine.

sourceString: The entire human population generally lacks immunity to SARS-CoV-2 and hence is susceptible to the novel virus.
targetString: संपूर्ण मानव जनसंख्या में सामान्यतः SARS-CoV-2 के प्रति प्रतिरोधकता की कमी है और इसलिए यह नोवेल वायरस के प्रति अतिसंवेदनशील है।
en-mt: The entire human population generally lacks immunity to SARS-CoV-2 and is therefore susceptible to the novel virus.

sourceString: Currently, no detailed study has been reported regarding the immunological response to SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: वर्तमान में SARS-CoV-2 के प्रति प्रतिरक्षाविज्ञानी प्रत्युत्तर के संबंध में कोई विस्तृत अध्ययन सूचित नहीं किया गया है।
en-mt: At present, no detailed study has been reported on immunological response to SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Thus, we can only refer to previous studies on other CoVs, especially SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV (Fig. ​(Fig.4).4).
targetString: इसलिए, हम केवल अन्य CoVs, विशेष रुप से SARS-CoV और MERS-CoV पर पिछले अध्ययनों का संदर्भ ही ले सकते हैं (चित्र (चित्र 4).4)।
en-mt: Therefore, we can only refer to previous studies on other CoVs, especially SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV (Fig. (Fig. 4).4).

sourceString: In general, after a virus invades the host, it is first recognized by the host innate immune system through pattern recognition receptors (PRRs) including C-type lectin-like receptors, Toll-like receptor (TLR), NOD-like receptor (NLR), and RIG-I-like receptor (RLR).
targetString: सामान्यतः, वायरस के पोषक में घुसने के बाद, यह पहली बार C-टाइप लेक्टिन-समान रिसेप्टर्स, टोल-समान रिसेप्टर्स (TLR), NOD-समान रिसेप्टर (NLR), और RIG-I-समान रिसेप्टर (RLR) सहित प्रतिरूप पहचान रिसेप्टर्स (PRR) से पोषक की अंतर्जात प्रतिरक्षा प्रणाली द्वारा पहचाना जाता है।
en-mt: In general, after the virus enters the nutrient, it is first identified by the nutrient's endogenous immune system from phenotypic recognition receptors (PRRs), including C-type lectin-like receptors (TLRs), toll-like receptors (TLRs), NOD-like receptors (NLRs), and RIG-I-like receptors (RLRs).

sourceString: Through different pathways, the virus induces the expression of inflammatory factors, maturation of dendritic cells, and synthesis of type I interferons (IFNs) which limit the spreading of the virus and accelerate macrophage phagocytosis of viral antigens.
targetString: विभिन्न मार्गों द्वारा, वायरस प्रदाह कारकों की अभिव्यक्ति, डेंड्रिटिक कोशिकाओं की परिपक्वता और प्रकार I इंटरफेरॉन (IFNs) का संश्लेषण प्रेरित करता है जो वायरस के प्रसार को सीमित करता है और वायरल प्रतिजनों के मेक्रोफेज फेगोसाइटोसिस में तेजी लाता है।
en-mt: By various pathways, the virus induces the expression of inflammatory factors, maturation of dendritic cells and the synthesis of type I interferons (IFNs) which limit the spread of the virus and accelerate the macrophage phagocytosis of viral antigens.

sourceString: However, the N protein of SARS-CoV can help the virus escape from the immune responses.
targetString: हालांकि, SARS-CoV का N प्रोटीन प्रतिरक्षा प्रतिक्रियाओं से बचने में वायरस की सहायता कर सकता है।
en-mt: However, the N protein of SARS-CoV can assist the virus in evading immune responses.

sourceString: Soon, the adaptive immune response joins the fight against the virus.
targetString: शीघ्र ही, अनुकूलित प्रतिरक्षा प्रतिक्रिया वायरस से लड़ने में शामिल हो जाती है।
en-mt: Soon, the optimized immune response gets involved in fighting the virus.

sourceString: T lymphocytes including CD4+ and CD8+ T cells play an important role in the defense.
targetString: CD4+ और CD8+ T कोशिकाओं सहित T लसीकाकोशिकाएं रक्षा में महत्वपूर्ण भूमिका निभाती हैं।
en-mt: T lymphocytes, including CD4+ and CD8+ T cells, play an important role in defense.

sourceString: CD4+ T cells stimulate B cells to produce virus-specific antibodies, and CD8+ T cells directly kill virus-infected cells.
targetString: CD4+ T कोशिकाएं वायरस-विशिष्ट प्रतिरक्षियों का उत्पादन करने के लिए B कोशिकाओं को उत्तेजित करती हैं और CD8+ T कोशिकाएं प्रत्यक्ष रूप से वायरस-संक्रमित कोशिकाओं को मार देती हैं।
en-mt: CD4+ T cells stimulate B cells to produce virus-specific antibodies and CD8+ T cells directly kill virus-infected cells.

sourceString: T helper cells produce proinflammatory cytokines to help the defending cells.
targetString: T सहायक कोशिकाएं रक्षा करने वाली कोशिकाओं की सहायता करने के लिए प्रदाह समर्थक साइटोकाइन का उत्पादन करती हैं।
en-mt: T helper cells produce pro-inflammatory cytokines to aid the protecting cells.

sourceString: However, CoV can inhibit T cell functions by inducing apoptosis of T cells.
targetString: हालांकि, CoV, T कोशिकाओं को मार कर T कोशिका कार्यों को अवरोधित कर सकती हैं।
en-mt: However, CoV can block T cell functions by killing T cells.

sourceString: The humoral immunity including complements such as C3a and C5a and antibodies is also essential in combating the viral infection.
targetString: C3a और C5a जैसे पूरकों और प्रतिरक्षियों सहित त्रिदोषन प्रतिरोधकता भी वायरल संक्रमण से लड़ने के लिए आवश्यक है।
en-mt: Tridospine resistance, including supplements and antibodies such as C3a and C5a, is also essential to fight viral infections.

sourceString: For example, antibodies isolated from a recovered patient neutralized MERS-CoV.
targetString: उदाहरण के लिए, ठीक हुए रोगी से पृथक किए गए प्रतिरक्षियों ने MERS-CoV को निष्क्रिय कर दिया।
en-mt: For example, antibodies isolated from a recovered patient inactivated MERS-CoV.

sourceString: On the other hand, an overreaction of the immune system generates a large number of free radicals locally that can cause severe damages to the lungs and other organs, and, in the worst scenario, multi-organ failure and even death.
targetString: दूसरी ओर, प्रतिरक्षा प्रणाली की अत्यधिक प्रतिक्रिया स्थानीय रूप से मुक्त कणों की बहुत बड़ी संख्या उत्पन्न करती है जो फेफड़ों और अन्य अंगों की गंभीर क्षति, और सबसे खराब स्थितियों में बहुअंग विफलता और मृत्यु भी उत्पन्न कर सकती है।
en-mt: On the other hand, the excessive response of the immune system locally generates very large numbers of free radicals that can cause severe damage to the lungs and other organs, and in the worst cases even multiorgan failure and death.

sourceString: The SARS-CoV-2 infection, featured by clustering onset, is more likely to affect elderly people with comorbidities and pregnant women.
targetString: झुंड में शुरुआत की विशेषता वाले SARS-CoV-2 संक्रमण की सहरुग्णता वाले बूढ़े लोगों और गर्भवती महिलाओं को प्रभावित करने की अधिक संभावना है।
en-mt: Older people and pregnant women with comorbidities of SARS-CoV-2 infection characterized by onset in the herd are more likely to be affected.

sourceString: It is common that for people who are exposed to a large number of viruses or whose immune functions are compromised, they have higher chance to be infected than others.
targetString: यह आम बात है कि जो लोग वायरस की अधिक संख्या के संपर्क में आते हैं या जिनके प्रतिरोधक कार्य मिले-जुले होते हैं, दूसरे की अपेक्षा उनके संक्रमित होने की अधिक संभावना होती है।
en-mt: It is common that people who are exposed to a higher number of viruses or have a mixed immune function are more likely to get infected than others.

sourceString: The estimated mean incubation period of SARS-CoV-2 is 1-14 days, mostly 3-7 days based on a study of the first 425 cases in Wuhan.
targetString: वुहान में पहले 425 मामलों के अध्ययन के आधार पर, SARS-CoV-2 की अनुमानित औसतन इन्क्यूबेशन अवधि 1-14 दिन है, अधिकतर 3-7 दिन।
en-mt: Based on the study of the first 425 cases in Wuhan, the estimated average incubation period of SARS-CoV-2 is 1-14 days, mostly 3-7 days.

sourceString: However, a study on 1,099 cases demonstrates that the incubation period was 3 days on average and ranged from 0 to 24 days.
targetString: हालांकि, 1,099 मामलों के अध्ययन में देखा गया कि इन्क्यूबेशन अवधि औसतन 3 दिन थी और इसकी सीमा 0 से 24 दिन थी।
en-mt: However, the study of 1,099 cases observed that the incubation period was an average of 3 days and its range was 0 to 24 days.

sourceString: A more recent study, as described above, demonstrates that the incubation period was 4.8 (3.0-7.2) days based on the demography of 8,866 cases.
targetString: जैसा ऊपर बताया गया है, 8,866 मामलों की जनसांख्यिकी के आधार पर हालिया अध्ययन में देखा गया कि इन्क्यूबेशन अवधि 4.8 (3.0-7.2) दिन थी।
en-mt: As mentioned above, a recent study based on the demographics of 8,866 cases observed that the incubation period was 4.8 (3.0-7.2) days.

sourceString: It is very important for health authorities to adjust the effective quarantine time based on the most accurate incubation period, thus preventing infected but symptomless people from transmitting the virus to others.
targetString: सबसे सटीक इन्क्यूबेशन अवधि के आधार पर प्रभावी क्वारंटीन समय को समायोजित करना और इस प्रकार संक्रमित लेकिन लक्षणहीन लोगों के वायरस को अन्य लोगों को संचारित करने से रोकना स्वास्थ्य प्राधिकरणों के लिए बहुत महत्वपूर्ण है।
en-mt: Adjusting the effective quarantine time based on the most accurate incubation period and thus preventing the virus of infected but asymptomatic people from transmitting to other people is very important for the health authorities.

sourceString: As a common practice, individuals exposed to, or infected by, the virus are usually required to be quarantined for 14 days.
targetString: सामान्य अभ्यास के रूप में, वायरस के संपर्क में आए या उससे संक्रमित लोगों को सामान्यतः 14 दिन के क्वारंटीन की आवश्यकता होती है।
en-mt: As a general practice, people who have been exposed to or infected with the virus usually require a 14-day quarantine.

sourceString: Should the quarantine time be extended to 24 days?
targetString: क्या क्वारंटीन समय को 24 दिनों तक बढ़ा दिया जाना चाहिए?
en-mt: Should the quarantine time be extended to 24 days?

sourceString: Fever is often the major and initial symptom of COVID-19, which can be accompanied by no symptom or other symptoms such as dry cough, shortness of breath, muscle ache, dizziness, headache, sore throat, rhinorrhea, chest pain, diarrhea, nausea, and vomiting.
targetString: बुखार प्रायः COVID-19 का प्रमुख तथा शुरुआती लक्षण है जिसके साथ कोई भी लक्षण नहीं हो सकता है या अन्य लक्षण जैसे कि सूखी खांसी, सांस की कमी, मांसपेशियों में दर्द, चक्कर आना, सिर दर्द, गले में खराश, नासास्राव, सीने में दर्द, दस्त, मतली और उल्टी शामिल हो सकते हैं।
en-mt: Fever is often the major and early symptom of COVID-19 that may be accompanied by no symptoms or may include other symptoms such as dry cough, shortness of breath, muscle pain, dizziness, headache, sore throat, runny nose, chest pain, diarrhea, nausea, and vomiting.

sourceString: Some patients experienced dyspnea and/or hypoxemia one week after the onset of the disease.
targetString: कुछ रोगियों ने रोग की शुरुआत के एक सप्ताह बाद श्वास कष्ट और/या हाइपोक्सेमिया का अनुभव किया।
en-mt: Some patients experienced shortness of breath and/or hypoxemia one week after the onset of the disease.

sourceString: In severe cases, patients quickly progressed to develop acute respiratory syndrome, septic shock, metabolic acidosis, and coagulopathy.
targetString: गंभीर मामलों में, रोगियों में तेजी से तीव्र श्वसन सिंड्रोम, सेप्टिक शॉक, चयापचय अम्लमयता और कॉगुलोपैथी के विकास की तेजी से वृद्धि हुई।
en-mt: In severe cases, patients developed rapid acute respiratory syndrome, septic shock, metabolic acidity and coagulopathy.

sourceString: Patients with fever and/or respiratory symptoms and acute fever, even without pulmonary imaging abnormalities, should be screened for the virus for early diagnosis.
targetString: बुखार और/या श्वसन लक्षण वाले और फुफ्फुसीय चित्रण असामान्यताओं के बिना भी तीव्र बुखार वाले रोगियों की समय पूर्व निदान हेतु वायरस के लिए जांच की जानी चाहिए।
en-mt: Patients with fever and/or respiratory symptoms and also with acute fever without pulmonary imaging abnormalities should be screened for the virus for early diagnosis.

sourceString: A demographic study in late December of 2019 showed that the percentages of the symptoms were 98% for fever, 76% for dry cough, 55% for dyspnea, and 3% for diarrhea; 8% of the patients required ventilation support.
targetString: दिसंबर 2019 के अंत में जनसांख्यिकी अध्ययन में देखा गया कि लक्षणों का प्रतिशत बुखार के लिए 98%, सूखी खांसी के लिए 76%, श्वास कष्ट के लिए 55% और दस्त के लिए 3% था; 8% रोगियों को वेंटिलेशन के सहारे की आवश्यकता पड़ी।
en-mt: The demographic study at the end of December 2019 observed that the percentage of symptoms was 98% for fever, 76% for dry cough, 55% for shortness of breath and 3% for diarrhea; About 8% of patients required ventilation.

sourceString: Similar findings were reported in two recent studies of a family cluster and a cluster caused by transmission from an asymptomatic individual.
targetString: परिवार झुंड और लक्षणहीन व्यक्ति से संचरण के द्वारा उत्पन्न झुंड के दो हालिया अध्ययनों में समान निष्कर्ष सूचित किए गए।
en-mt: Two recent studies of herds generated by transmission from the family herd and the asymptomatic individual reported similar findings.

sourceString: Comparably, a demographic study in 2012 showed that MERS-CoV patients also had fever (98%), dry cough (47%), and dyspnea (55%) as their main symptoms.
targetString: तुलनात्मक रूप से, 2012 के जनसांख्यिकी अध्ययन में देखा गया कि MERS-CoV रोगियों में भी मुख्य लक्षण के रूप में बुखार (98%), सूखी खांसी (47%) और श्वास कष्ट (55%) थे।
en-mt: By comparison, a 2012 demographic study observed that MERS-CoV patients also had fever (98%), dry cough (47%) and shortness of breath (55%) as the main symptoms.

sourceString: However, 80% of them required ventilation support, much more than COVID-19 patients and consistent with the higher lethality of MERS than of COVID-19.
targetString: हालांकि, COVID-19 रोगियों से कहीं अधिक, उनमें से 80% रोगियों में वेंटिलेशन के सहारे की आवश्यकता पड़ी और यह COVID-19 की अपेक्षा MERS की अधिक घातकता के अनुरूप है।
en-mt: However, more than covid-19 patients, 80% of them required ventilation, and this is consistent with the greater lethality of MERS than COVID-19.

sourceString: Diarrhea (26%) and sore throat (21%) were also observed with MERS patients.
targetString: दस्त (26%) और गले की खराश (21%) को भी MERS के रोगियों में देखा गया।
en-mt: Diarrhea (26%) and sore throat (21%) were also seen in patients with MERS.

sourceString: In SARS patients, it has been demonstrated that fever (99%-100%), dry cough (29%-75%), dyspnea (40%-42%), diarrhea (20-25%), and sore throat (13-25%) were the major symptoms and ventilation support was required for approximately 14%-20% of the patients.
targetString: SARS रोगियों में देखा गया है कि बुखार (99%-100%), सूखी खांसी (29%-75%), श्वास कष्ट (40%-42%), दस्त (20-25%) और गले की खराश (13-25%) प्रमुख लक्षण थे और लगभग 14%-20% रोगियों को वेंटिलेशन के सहारे की आवश्यकता पड़ी।
en-mt: In SARS patients, fever (99%-100%), dry cough (29%-75%), shortness of breath (40%-42%), diarrhea (20-25%) and sore throat (13-25%) were the major symptoms and about 14%-20% of patients required ventilation.

sourceString: By February 14, the mortality of COVID-19 was 2% when the confirmed cases reached 66,576 globally.
targetString: 14 फरवरी तक COVID-19 की मृत्यु दर 2% थी, जब विश्व भर में पुष्टिकृत मामलें 66,576 तक पहुंच गए थे।
en-mt: The COVID-19 death rate was 2% as of February 14, when confirmed cases worldwide reached 66,576.

sourceString: Comparably, the mortality of SARS by November 2002 was 10% of 8,096 confirmed cases.
targetString: तुलनात्मक रूप से, नवंबर 2002 तक SARS की मृत्यु दर 8,096 पुष्टिकृत मामलों की 10% थी।
en-mt: By comparison, the SARS mortality rate as of November 2002 was 10% of the 8,096 confirmed cases.

sourceString: For MERS, based on a demographic study in June 2012, the mortality was 37% of 2,494 confirmed cases.
targetString: MERS के लिये, जून 2012 के जनसांख्यिकीय अध्ययन के आधार पर मृत्यु दर 2,494 पुष्टिकृत मामलों की 37% थी।
en-mt: For MERS, the mortality rate based on the June 2012 demographic study was 37% of the 2,494 confirmed cases.

sourceString: An earlier study reported that the R0 of SARS-CoV-2 was as high as 6.47 with a 95% confidence interval (CI) of 5.71-7.23, whereas the R0 of SARS-CoV only ranged from 2 to 4.
targetString: पहले के अध्ययन में सूचित किया गया कि SARS-CoV-2 का R0 5.71-7.23 के 95% विश्वास अंतराल (CI) के साथ 6.47 अधिक था जबकि SARS-CoV का R0 केवल 2 से 4 के बीच में था।
en-mt: An earlier study reported that the R0 of SARS-CoV-2 was 6.47 higher with a 95% confidence interval (CI) of 5.71-7.23 while the R0 of SARS-CoV was only between 2 and 4.

sourceString: A comparison of SARS-CoV-2 with MERS-CoV and SARA-CoV regarding their symptoms, mortality, and R0 is presented in Table ​Table1.1.
targetString: लक्षणों, मृत्यु दर और R0 के संबंध में SARS-CoV-2 की MERS-CoV और SARA-CoV से तुलना तालिका तालिका 1.1 में प्रस्तुत की जाती है।
en-mt: Comparison of SARS-CoV-2 with MERS-CoV and SARA-CoV with respect to symptoms, mortality, and R0 is presented in Table 1.1.

sourceString: The above figures suggest that SARS-CoV-2 has a higher ability to spread than MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV, but it is less lethal than the latter two.
targetString: उपर्युक्त आंकड़े संकेत देते हैं कि SARS-CoV-2 की फैलने की क्षमता MERS-CoV और SARS-CoV से अधिक है, लेकिन यह बाद के दोनों से कम घातक है।
en-mt: The above data indicate that the spread capacity of SARS-CoV-2 is higher than that of MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV, but it is less lethal than both of the latter.

sourceString: Thus, it is much more challenging to control the epidemic of SARS-CoV-2 than those of MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV.
targetString: इसलिए, SARS-CoV-2 की महामारी को नियंत्रित करना MERS-CoV और SARS-CoV की अपेक्षा अधिक चुनौतीपूर्ण है।
en-mt: Therefore, controlling the epidemic of SARS-CoV-2 is more challenging than MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV.

sourceString: Clustered onset often happens in the same family or from the same gathering or vehicle such as a cruise ship.
targetString: झुंड में शुरुआत प्रायः एक ही परिवार या एक ही जनसमूह या वाहन जैसे कि क्रूज जलयान से होती है।
en-mt: Swarms often begin with the same family or the same population or vehicle, such as a cruise ship.

sourceString: Patients often have a history of travel or residence in Wuhan or other affected areas or contact with infected individuals or patients in the recent two weeks before the onset.
targetString: रोगियों का प्रायः शुरुआत से पिछले दो सप्ताह के अंदर वुहान या अन्य प्रभावित क्षेत्रों में यात्रा या निवास या संक्रमित व्यक्तियों या रोगियों से संपर्क का इतिहास होता है।
en-mt: Patients often have a history of travel or residence or contact with infected persons or patients in Wuhan or other affected areas within the last two weeks from the beginning.

sourceString: However, it has been reported that people can carry the virus without symptoms longer than two weeks and cured patients discharged from hospitals can carry the virus again, which sends out an alarm to increase the time for quarantine.
targetString: हालांकि, यह सूचित किया गया है कि लोग दो सप्ताह से अधिक समय तक बिना लक्षणों के वायरस का संवहन कर सकते हैं और अस्पताल से छुट्टी किए गए ठीक हुए रोगी फिर से वायरस का संवहन कर सकते हैं, जो क्वारंटीन का समय बढ़ाने की चेतावनी देता है।
en-mt: However, it has been reported that people can carry the virus without symptoms for more than two weeks and recovered patients discharged from the hospital can transmit the virus again, warning of an extended quarantine time.

sourceString: Patients have normal or reduced number of peripheral white blood cells (especially lymphocytes) at the early stage.
targetString: शुरुआती चरण में रोगियों में परिधीय श्वेत रक्त कोशिकाओं (विशेष रूप से लसीका कोशिकाओं) की संख्या सामान्य या कम होती है।
en-mt: The number of peripheral white blood cells (especially lymphatic cells) in patients at an early stage is normal or low.

sourceString: For example, lymphopenia with white blood cell count < 4×109/L including lymphocyte count < 1×109/L, and elevated aspartate aminotransferase levels and viremia were found in 1,099 COVID-19 patients.
targetString: उदाहरण के लिए, लसीका कोशिका गणना < 1×109/L सहित श्वेत रक्त कोशिका गणना < 4×109/L के साथ लिंफोपेनिया और बढ़े हुए एस्पार्टेट अमीनोट्रांसफरेस स्तर और विषाणुरक्तता 1,099 COVID-19 रोगियों में पाए गए।
en-mt: For example, lymphopenia and increased aspartate aminotransferase levels and virulence were found in 1,099 COVID-19 patients with white blood cell count < 4×109/L including lymph cell count < 1×109/L.

sourceString: The levels of liver and muscle enzymes and myoglobin were increased in the blood of some patients, and C-reactive protein and erythrocyte sedimentation were increased in the blood of most patients.
targetString: कुछ रोगियों के रक्त में यकृत और मांसपेशी एंजाइम और मायोग्लोबिन के स्तर बढ़ गए और अधिकतर रोगियों के रक्त में सी-प्रतिक्रियाशील प्रोटीन और एरिथ्रोसाइट अवसादन बढ़ गया।
en-mt: Some patients had increased levels of liver and muscle enzymes and myoglobin in their blood, and most patients had increased C-reactive protein and erythrocyte sedimentation in their blood.

sourceString: In patients with severe cases, the level of D-dimer, a fibrin degradation product present in the blood, was elevated, and lymphocyte count was progressively reduced.
targetString: गंभीर मामलों वाले रोगियों में, रक्त में उपस्थित फाइब्रिन पतन का एक उत्पाद, डी-डाइमर का स्तर, बढ़ा हुआ था और लसीका कोशिका गणना निरंतर घटती चली गई।
en-mt: In patients with severe cases, the level of D-dimer, a product of fibrin collapse present in the blood, was increased and the lymphatic cell count continued to decrease.

sourceString: Abnormalities in chest radiography are found in most COVID-19 patients and featured by bilateral patchy shadows or ground glass opacity in the lungs.
targetString: अधिकतर COVID-19 रोगियों में सीने की रेडियोग्राफी में असामान्यताएं पाई जाती हैं और फेफड़ों में द्विपक्षीय धब्बेदार छवियां या ग्राउंड ग्लास अस्पष्टता द्वारा दर्शाया गया है।
en-mt: Abnormalities are found in chest radiography in most COVID-19 patients and are represented by bilateral macular images or ground glass opacity in the lungs.

sourceString: Patients often develop an atypical pneumonia, acute lung injury, and acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS).
targetString: रोगियों में प्रायः असामान्य निमोनिया, फेफड़ों की तीव्र क्षति और तीव्र श्वसन संकट सिंड्रोम (ARDS) विकसित हो जाता है।
en-mt: Patients often develop abnormal pneumonia, acute lung damage and acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS).

sourceString: When ARDS happens, uncontrolled inflammation, fluid accumulation, and progressive fibrosis severely compromise the gas exchange.
targetString: जब ARDS होता है, तो अनियंत्रित प्रदाह, द्रव्य संचय तथा प्रगतिशील फाइब्रोसिस के कारण गैस विनिमय से गंभीर रूप से समझौता होता है।
en-mt: When ARDS occurs, gas exchange is severely compromised due to uncontrolled inflammation, fluid accumulation and progressive fibrosis.

sourceString: Dysfunction of type-I and type-II pneumocytes decreases the surfactant level and increases surface tension, thus reducing the ability of the lungs to expand and heightening the risk of lung collapse.
targetString: प्रकार-I और प्रकार-II न्यूमोसाइट की दुष्क्रिया पृष्ठसक्रियकारक स्तर को घटा देती है और सतह के तनाव को बढ़ा देती है और इस प्रकार फेफड़ों के फूलने की क्षमता को कम कर देती है और फेफड़ों के काम करना बंद करने के जोख़िम को बढ़ा देती है।
en-mt: Type-I and type-II pneumocyte dysfunction reduces the dorsal activator level and increases the surface tension, thus reducing the ability of the lungs to swell and increase the risk of lung failure.

sourceString: Therefore, the worst chest radiographic findings often parallel the most severe extent of the disease.
targetString: इसलिए, सीने के रेडियोग्राफी के सबसे खराब निष्कर्ष प्रायः रोग की सबसे गंभीर स्थिति के साथ समानांतर रहते हैं।
en-mt: Therefore, the worst findings of chest radiography often remain parallel with the most severe condition of the disease.

sourceString: On February 18, 2020, the first pathological analysis of COVID-19 demonstrated the desquamation of pneumocytes, hyaline membrane formation, and interstitial lymphocyte infiltration, and multinucleated syncytial cells in the lungs of a patient who died of the disease, consistent with the pathology of viral infection and ARDS and similar to that of SARS and MERS patients.
targetString: 18 फरवरी 2020 को COVID-19 पर पहले रोग-निदान संबंधी विश्लेषण में रोग से मरे किसी रोगी के फेफड़ों में न्यूमोसाइट का विशल्कन, ह्यालिन झिल्ली का बनना और लसीका कोशिकाओं का छिद्रपूर्ण रिसाव, और बहुनाभिकीय बहुकेंद्रिक कोशिकाओं को देखा गया जो वायरल संक्रमण के रोग-विज्ञान और ARDS के अनुरूप था और SARS और MERS रोगियों के समान था।
