sourceString: Those who may already have the infection have been advised to wear a surgical mask in public.
targetString: जिन लोगों को पहले से संक्रमण हो सकता है, उन्हें सार्वजनिक जगहों पर सर्जिकल मास्क पहनने की सलाह दी जाती है।
en-mt: People who may have pre-existing infection are advised to wear surgical masks in public places.

sourceString: Physical distancing measures are also recommended to prevent transmission.Many governments have restricted or advised against all non-essential travel to and from countries and areas affected by the outbreak.
targetString: संचरण को रोकने के लिए शारीरिक दूरी बनाने के उपायों की भी अनुशंसा की जाती है। कई सरकारों ने प्रकोप से प्रभावित देशों और क्षेत्रों में सभी गैर-आवश्यक आना-जाना प्रतिबंधित कर दिया है या न आने-जाने की सलाह दी है।
en-mt: Physical distancing measures are also recommended to prevent transmission. Several governments have restricted or advised no movement of all non-essential movements in countries and regions affected by the outbreak.

sourceString: However, the virus has reached the stage of community spread in large parts of the world.
targetString: हालाँकि, वायरस विश्व के बड़े हिस्सों में समुदायिक संचरण की अवस्था तक पहुँच गया है।
en-mt: However, the virus has reached the stage of community transmission in large parts of the world.

sourceString: This means that the virus is spreading within communities, and some community members don't know where or how they were infected.Health care providers taking care of someone who may be infected are recommended to use standard precautions, contact precautions, and eye protection.Contact tracing is an important method for health authorities to determine the source of an infection and to prevent further transmission.
targetString: इसका मतलब है कि वायरस समुदायों के भीतर फैल रहा है, और समुदाय के कुछ सदस्यों को यह नहीं पता है कि वे कहाँ और कैसे संक्रमित हुए। किसी संक्रमित व्यक्ति की देखभाल करने वाले देखभाल प्रदाताओं को मानक सावधानियों, संपर्क सावधानियों को बरतने और आँखों की सुरक्षा करने की अनुशंसा की जाती है। संक्रमण का स्रोत निर्धारित करने और आगे संचरण को रोकने के लिए स्वास्थ्य प्राधिकरणों के लिए संपर्क अनुरेखण एक महत्वपूर्ण तरीका है।
en-mt: This means the virus is spreading within communities, and some members of the community don't know where and how they got infected. Care providers caring for an infected person are recommended to take standard precautions, contact precautions, and protect the eyes. Contact tracing is an important method for health authorities to determine the source of infection and prevent further transmission.

sourceString: The use of location data from mobile phones by governments for this purpose has prompted privacy concerns, with Amnesty International and over 100 other organizations issuing a statement calling for limits on this kind of surveillance.
targetString: इस उद्देश्य के लिए सरकारों द्वारा मोबाइल फोनों के स्थान डेटा के उपयोग से गोपनीयता की चिंताएं बढ़ गई हैं, जिसके लिए एमनेस्टी इंटरनेशनल और 100 से अधिक अन्य संगठनों ने इस तरह की निगरानी पर सीमाओं के लिए एक बयान जारी किया है।
en-mt: Privacy concerns have been raised by the use of mobile phone location data by governments for this purpose, for which Amnesty International and more than 100 other organisations have issued a statement calling for limitations on such surveillance.

sourceString: Various mobile apps have been implemented or proposed for voluntary use, and as of April 7, 2020, over a dozen expert groups were working on privacy-friendly solutions, such as using Bluetooth to log a user's proximity to other cellphones.
targetString: स्वैच्छिक उपयोग के लिए विभिन्न मोबाइल एप्लिकेशन कार्यान्वित या प्रस्तावित किए गए हैं, और 7 अप्रैल, 2020 तक, एक दर्जन से अधिक विशेषज्ञ समूह गोपनीयता-अनुकूल समाधानों पर काम कर रहे थे, जैसे कि एक उपयोगकर्ता की अन्य सेलफोनों से निकटता लॉग करने के लिए ब्लूटूथ का उपयोग करना।
en-mt: Various mobile applications have been implemented or proposed for voluntary use, and as of April 7, 2020, more than a dozen expert groups were working on privacy-friendly solutions, such as using Bluetooth to log a user's proximity to other cellphones.

sourceString: Users then receive a message if they've been in close contact with someone who has tested positive for COVID-19.Misconceptions are circulating about how to prevent infection; for example, rinsing the nose and gargling with mouthwash are not effective.
targetString: उपयोगकर्ता तब एक संदेश प्राप्त करते हैं यदि वे COVID-19 परीक्षण पॉज़िटिव आए किसी व्यक्ति के निकट संपर्क में हों। संक्रमण की रोकथाम के तरीकों के बारे में गलत धारणाएं फैल रही हैं; उदाहरण के लिए, नाक को रगड़ना और माउथवॉश से गरारा करना प्रभावी नहीं है।
en-mt: Users then receive a message if they are in close contact with someone who has tested positive for COVID-19. Misconceptions about methods of infection prevention are spreading; For example, rubbing the nose and gargling with a mouthwash is not effective.

sourceString: There is no COVID-19 vaccine, though many organizations are working to develop one.
targetString: कोई COVID-19 टीका उपलब्ध नहीं है, हालाँकि कई संगठन एक टीका विकसित करने के लिए काम कर रहे हैं।
en-mt: There is no COVID-19 vaccine available, although several organizations are working to develop a vaccine.

sourceString: Hand washing is recommended to prevent the spread of the disease.
targetString: रोग के संचरण को रोकने के लिए हाथ धोने की अनुशंसा की जाती है।
en-mt: Hand washing is recommended to prevent transmission of the disease.

sourceString: The CDC recommends that people wash hands often with soap and water for at least twenty seconds, especially after going to the toilet or when hands are visibly dirty; before eating; and after blowing one's nose, coughing, or sneezing.
targetString: CDC अनुशंसा करता है कि लोग कम से कम बीस सेकेंड के लिए बार-बार साबुन और पानी से हाथ धोएँ, खासकर शौचालय जाने के बाद या जब हाथ गंदे दिखाई दें; खाने से पहले; और नाक छिड़कने, खाँसने या छींकने के बाद।
en-mt: The CDC recommends that people wash their hands frequently with soap and water for at least twenty seconds, especially after going to the toilet or when hands appear dirty; Before eating; And after spraying the nose, coughing or sneezing.

sourceString: This is because outside the human body, the virus is killed by household soap, which bursts its protective bubble.
targetString: ऐसा इसलिए है क्योंकि मानव शरीर के बाहर, वायरस को घरेलू साबुन द्वारा मार दिया जाता है, जो इसके सुरक्षात्मक बुलबुले को फोड़ देता है।
en-mt: This is because outside the human body, the virus is killed by household soap, which bursts its protective bubbles.

sourceString: CDC further recommended using an alcohol-based hand sanitizer with at least 60% alcohol by volume when soap and water are not readily available.
targetString: इसके अतिरिक्त CDC ने कम से कम 60% अल्कोहल वाले अल्कोहल-आधारित हैंड सैनिटाइज़र का उपयोग करने की अनुशंसा की है, जब साबुन और पानी आसानी से उपलब्ध नहीं होते हैं।
en-mt: Additionally the CDC recommends using an alcohol-based hand sanitizer containing at least 60% alcohol when soap and water are not readily available.

sourceString: The WHO advises people to avoid touching the eyes, nose, or mouth with unwashed hands.
targetString: WHO लोगों को सलाह देता है कि वे बिना धुले हाथों से आँखों, नाक या मुहँ को छूने से बचें।
en-mt: Who advises people to avoid touching eyes, nose or mouth with unwashed hands.

sourceString: Surfaces may be decontaminated with a number of solutions (within one minute of exposure to the disinfectant for a stainless steel surface), including 62–71% ethanol, 50–100% isopropanol, 0.1% sodium hypochlorite, 0.5% hydrogen peroxide, and 0.2–7.5% povidone-iodine.
targetString: सतहों को 62–71% इथेनॉल, 50–100% आइसोप्रोपेनॉल, 0.1% सोडियम हाइपोक्लोराइट, 0.5% हाइड्रोजन परॉक्साइड, और 0.2–7.5% पोविडोन-आयोडीन सहित कई घोलों से कीटाणुरहित किया जा सकता है (एक स्टेनलेस स्टील की सतह के लिए कीटाणुनाशक के संपर्क के एक मिनट के भीतर)।
en-mt: Surfaces can be disinfected with several solutions including 62–71% ethanol, 50–100% isopropanol, 0.1% sodium hypochlorite, 0.5% hydrogen peroxide, and 0.2–7.5% povidone-iodine (within a minute of exposure to a disinfectant to a stainless steel surface).

sourceString: Other solutions, such as benzalkonium chloride and chrohexidine gluconate, are less effective.
targetString: अन्य घोल, जैसे कि बेंज़ालकोनियम क्लोराइड और क्रोहेक्सिडिन ग्लूकोनेट, कम प्रभावी हैं।
en-mt: Other solutions, such as benzalkonium chloride and crohepcidin gluconate, are less effective.

sourceString: The CDC recommends that if a COVID case is suspected or confirmed at a facility such as an office or day care, all areas such as offices, bathrooms, common areas, shared electronic equipment like tablets, touch screens, keyboards, remote controls, and ATM machines used by the ill persons, should be disinfected.
targetString: CDC अनुशंसा करता है कि यदि किसी कार्यालय या डे केयर जैसी सुविधा पर COVID मामले का संदेह या पुष्टि होती है तो सभी क्षेत्रों जैसे कार्यालयों, शौचालयों, सार्वजनिक स्थानों, साझा किए गए इलेक्ट्रॉनिक उपकरण जैसे टैबलेटों, टच स्क्रीनों, कीबोर्डों, रिमोट कंट्रोलों, और बीमार व्यक्तियों द्वारा उपयोग की जाने वाली ATM मशीनें आदि कीटाणुरहित किए जाने चाहिए।
en-mt: The CDC recommends that if a COVID case is suspected or confirmed at an office or facility such as day care, all areas such as offices, toilets, public places, shared electronic devices such as tablets, touch screens, keyboards, remote controls, and ATM machines used by sick persons should be disinfected.

sourceString: Health organizations recommended that people cover their mouth and nose with a bent elbow or a tissue when coughing or sneezing, and disposing of any tissue immediately.
targetString: स्वास्थ्य संगठन अनुशंसा करते हैं कि लोग खाँसते या छींकते समय अपने मुँह और नाक को कोहनी मोड़कर या एक टिश्यू से ढँकें और फिर किसी भी टिश्यू का तुरंत निपटान कर दें।
en-mt: Health organizations recommend that people cover their mouth and nose with an elbow twist or a tissue when coughing or sneezing and then dispose of any tissue immediately.

sourceString: Surgical masks are recommended for those who may be infected, as wearing a mask can limit the volume and travel distance of expiratory droplets dispersed when talking, sneezing, and coughing.
targetString: सर्जिकल मास्क की अनुशंसा उन लोगों के लिए की जाती है जो संक्रमित हो सकते हैं, क्योंकि मास्क पहनने से बात करने, छींकने और खाँसने पर फैलने वाली साँस से निकली बूंदों की मात्रा और तय की जाने वाली दूरी सीमित हो सकती है।
en-mt: Surgical masks are recommended for people who may be infected, as wearing a mask can limit the amount of inhaled droplets that spread when talking, sneezing, and coughing, and the distance traveled.

sourceString: The WHO has issued instructions on when and how to use masks.
targetString: WHO ने मास्कों का उपयोग कब और कैसे किया जाए, इस बारे में निर्देश जारी किए हैं।
en-mt: WHO has issued instructions on when and how to use masks.

sourceString: According to Stephen Griffin, a virologist at the University of Leeds, "Wearing a mask can reduce the propensity [of] people to touch their faces, which is a major source of infection without proper hand hygiene."Masks have also been recommended for use by those taking care of someone who may have the disease.
targetString: यूनिवर्सिटी ऑफ लीड्स के एक वायरोलॉजिस्ट स्टीफन ग्रिफिन के अनुसार, "मास्क पहनने से लोगों के अपने चेहरे को छूने की प्रवृत्ति कम हो सकती है, जो हाथ की उचित स्वच्छता के बिना संक्रमण का एक प्रमुख स्रोत है।" मास्कों का उपयोग उन लोगों द्वारा किए जाने की भी अनुशंसा की गई है जो रोग से ग्रस्त किसी व्यक्ति की देखभाल कर रहे हैं।
en-mt: According to Stephen Griffin, a virologist at the University of Leeds, "Wearing masks can reduce people's tendency to touch their faces, which is a major source of infection without proper hand hygiene." Masks are also recommended to be used by people who are caring for someone with the disease.

sourceString: The WHO has recommended the wearing of masks by healthy people only if they are at high risk, such as those who are caring for a person with COVID-19, although they also acknowledge that wearing masks may help people avoid touching their face.
targetString: WHO ने स्वस्थ लोगों द्वारा मास्क पहनने की अनुशंसा केवल तब की है यदि वे उच्च जोखिम में हैं, जैसे कि वे जो COVID-19 वाले व्यक्ति की देखभाल कर रहे हैं, हालाँकि वे यह भी स्वीकार करते हैं कि मास्क पहनने से लोगों को अपना चेहरा छूने से बचने में मदद मिल सकती है।
en-mt: The WHO recommends wearing masks by healthy people only if they are at high risk, such as those who are caring for a person with COVID-19, although they also acknowledge that wearing masks can help people avoid touching their face.

sourceString: Several countries have started to encourage the use of face masks by members of the public.
targetString: कई देशों ने सामान्य व्यक्तियों द्वारा चेहरे के मास्क के उपयोग को प्रोत्साहित करना शुरू कर दिया है।
en-mt: Many countries have started encouraging the use of face masks by ordinary individuals.

sourceString: In the U.S., the CDC recommends wearing non-medical face mask made out of cloth.China has specifically recommended the use of disposable medical masks by healthy members of the public, particularly when coming into close contact (1 metre (3 ft) or less) with other people.
targetString: अमेरिका में, CDC कपड़े से बने गैर-चिकित्सीय चेहरे का मास्क पहनने की अनुशंसा करता है। चीन ने विशेष रूप से सामान्य स्वस्थ लोगों द्वारा निपटान-योग्य चिकित्सीय मास्कों के उपयोग की अनुशंसा की है, विशेष रूप से जब वे दूसरे लोगों के साथ निकट संपर्क (1 मीटर (3 फीट) या उससे कम) में आते हैं।
en-mt: In the U.S., the CDC recommends wearing a non-medical face mask made of cloth. China recommends the use of disposable therapeutic masks by generally healthy people, especially when they come into close contact (1 meter (3 feet) or less) with other people.

sourceString: Hong Kong recommends wearing a surgical mask when taking public transport or staying in crowded places.
targetString: सार्वजनिक परिवहन का उपयोग करते समय या भीड़-भाड़ वाली जगहों पर रहने पर हॉन्ग कॉन्ग सर्जिकल मास्क पहनने की अनुशंसा करता है।
en-mt: Hong Kong recommends wearing surgical masks when using public transport or living in crowded places.

sourceString: Thailand's health officials are encouraging people to make cloth facemasks at home and wash them daily.
targetString: थाईलैंड के स्वास्थ्य अधिकारी लोगों को घर पर कपड़े के चेहरे के मास्क बनाने और उन्हें रोज़ धोने के लिए प्रोत्साहित कर रहे हैं।
en-mt: Thailand's health authorities are encouraging people to make cloth face masks at home and wash them daily.

sourceString: The Czech Republic and Slovakia banned going out in public without wearing a mask or covering one's nose and mouth.
targetString: चेक गणराज्य और स्लोवाकिया ने बिना मास्क पहने या नाक और मुहँ ढँके बिना सार्वजनिक स्थानों पर बाहर जाने पर प्रतिबंध लगा दिया है।
en-mt: The Czech Republic and Slovakia have banned going out in public places without wearing a mask or covering the nose and mouth.

sourceString: On 16 March, Vietnam requested everyone to wear a face mask when going to public areas in order to protect themselves and others.
targetString: 16 मार्च को, वियतनाम ने स्वयं की और दूसरों की सुरक्षा के लिए सार्वजनिक क्षेत्रों में जाने पर सभी को चेहरे का मास्क पहनने का अनुरोध किया है।
en-mt: On March 16, Vietnam has requested everyone to wear face masks when going to public areas to protect themselves and others.

sourceString: The Austrian government mandated that everyone entering a grocery store must wear a face mask.
targetString: ऑस्ट्रियाई सरकार ने किराने की दुकान में प्रवेश करने वाले सभी व्यक्तियों को चेहरे का मास्क पहनना अनिवार्य किया है।
en-mt: The Austrian government has made it mandatory for all individuals entering the grocery store to wear face masks.

sourceString: Israel has asked all residents to wear face masks when in public.
targetString: इज़रायल ने सभी नागरिकों को सार्वजनिक क्षेत्र में जाने पर चेहरे का मास्क पहनने के लिए कहा है।
en-mt: Israel has asked all citizens to wear face masks when going to a public area.

sourceString: Taiwan, which has been producing ten million masks per day since mid-March, required passengers on trains and intercity buses to wear face masks on 1 April.
targetString: मध्य मार्च के बाद से प्रति दिन, दस मिलियन मास्कों का उत्पादन करने वाले ताइवान ने 1 अप्रैल को रेलों और अंतरशहर बसों में यात्रियों द्वारा चेहरे का मास्क पहनना अनिवार्य किया है।
en-mt: Taiwan, which has produced ten million masks per day since mid-March, has mandated the wearing of face masks by passengers on rails and intercity buses on April 1.

sourceString: Panama has made it obligatory to wear a face mask whenever going outside, while also recommending the manufacture of a homemade face mask for those who cannot purchase face masks.
targetString: पनामा ने बाहर जाते समय चेहरे का मास्क पहनना अनिवार्य कर दिया है, जबकि उन लोगों के लिए घर में बने चेहरे का मास्क बनाने की भी अनुशंसा की गई है जो चेहरे का मास्क नहीं खरीद सकते।
en-mt: Panama has made it mandatory to wear face masks while going out, while also recommending making homemade face masks for those who cannot afford face masks.

sourceString: Face masks have also been widely used in Japan, South Korea, Malaysia, and Singapore.
targetString: चेहरे के मास्क का जापान, दक्षिण कोरिया, मलेशिया और सिंगापुर में भी व्यापक रूप से उपयोग किया गया है।
en-mt: Face masks have also been widely used in Japan, South Korea, Malaysia and Singapore.

sourceString: Social distancing (also known as physical distancing) includes infection control actions intended to slow the spread of disease by minimizing close contact between individuals.
targetString: सामाजिक दूरी बनाना (जिसे शारीरिक दूरी बनाना भी कहा जाता है) में संक्रमण नियंत्रण कार्य शामिल हैं, जिसका उद्देश्य व्यक्तियों के बीच निकट संपर्क को कम करके रोग के प्रसार को धीमा करना है।
en-mt: Social distancing (also called physical distancing) involves infection control actions, aimed at slowing the spread of the disease by reducing close contact between individuals.

sourceString: Methods include quarantines; travel restrictions; and the closing of schools, workplaces, stadiums, theatres, or shopping centres.
targetString: इसके तरीकों में शामिल हैं क्वारंटीन; यात्रा संबंधी प्रतिबंध; और विद्यालयों, कार्यस्थलों, स्टेडियमों, थिएटरों, या खरीदारी केंद्रों का बंद होना।
en-mt: Its methods include quarantine; Travel restrictions; And the closure of schools, workplaces, stadiums, theaters, or shopping centers.

sourceString: Individuals may apply social distancing methods by staying at home, limiting travel, avoiding crowded areas, using no-contact greetings, and physically distancing themselves from others.
targetString: व्यक्ति घर पर रहकर, यात्रा को सीमित करके, भीड़-भाड़ वाले क्षेत्रों से बचकर, बिना संपर्क के अभिवादन का उपयोग करके, और दूसरों से स्वयं को शारीरिक रूप से दूर करके सामाजिक दूरी बनाने के तरीकों को लागू कर सकते हैं।
en-mt: Individuals can implement ways to create social distancing by staying at home, limiting travel, avoiding crowded areas, using greetings without contact, and physically distancing themselves from others.

sourceString: Many governments are now mandating or recommending social distancing in regions affected by the outbreak.
targetString: कई सरकारें अब प्रकोप से प्रभावित क्षेत्रों में सामाजिक दूरी बनाने को अनिवार्य या अनुशंसित कर रही हैं।
en-mt: Many governments are now mandating or recommending social distancing in areas affected by the outbreak.

sourceString: The maximum gathering size recommended by US government bodies and health organizations was swiftly reduced from 250 people (if there was no known COVID-19 spread in a region) to 50 people, and later to 10 people.
targetString: अमेरिकी सरकारी निकायों और स्वास्थ्य संगठनों द्वारा अनुशंसित अधिकतम जनसमूह में तेजी से कमी करके 250 लोगों (यदि किसी क्षेत्र में कोई ज्ञात COVID-19 संचरण नहीं था) से 50 लोगों तक किया गया, और बाद में 10 लोगों तक किया गया।
en-mt: The maximum mass reduction recommended by U.S. government bodies and health organizations was made rapidly from 250 people (if there was no known COVID-19 transmission in an area) to 50 people, and later to 10 people.

sourceString: On 22 March 2020, Germany banned public gatherings of more than two people.Older adults and those with underlying medical conditions such as diabetes, heart disease, respiratory disease, hypertension, and compromised immune systems face increased risk of serious illness and complications and have been advised by the CDC to stay home as much as possible in areas of community outbreak.In late March 2020, the WHO and other health bodies began to replace the use of the term "social distancing" with "physical distancing", to clarify that the aim is to reduce physical contact while maintaining social connections, either virtually or at a distance.
targetString: 22 मार्च 2020 को, जर्मनी ने दो से अधिक लोगों के सार्वजनिक जनसमूह पर प्रतिबंध लगा दिया। बुज़ुर्ग वयस्कों और मधुमेह, हृदय रोग, श्वसन रोग, उच्च रक्तचाप, और क्षीण प्रतिरक्षा प्रणाली जैसी अंतर्निहित चिकित्सा स्थितियों वाले व्यक्तियों में गंभीर रोग और जटिलताओं का खतरा अधिक है और उन्हें CDC द्वारा यह सलाह दी जाती है कि समुदायिक प्रकोप वाले क्षेत्रों में जितना संभव हो सके घर में रहें। मार्च 2020 के अंत में, WHO और अन्य स्वास्थ्य निकायों ने "सामाजिक दूरी बनाना" शब्द के उपयोग को "शारीरिक दूरी बनाना" के साथ बदलना शुरू कर दिया, ताकि यह स्पष्ट किया जा सके कि उद्देश्य सामाजिक संपर्क को या तो आभासी या दूरस्थ बनाए रखते हुए शारीरिक संपर्क को कम करना है।
en-mt: On 22 March 2020, Germany banned public gatherings of more than two people. Older adults and individuals with underlying medical conditions such as diabetes, heart disease, respiratory disease, hypertension, and a weakened immune system are at higher risk of serious disease and complications and are advised by the CDC to stay home as much as possible in areas with community outbreaks. In late March 2020, the WHO and other health bodies began replacing the use of the term "social distancing" with "physical distancing" to make it clear that the aim is to reduce physical contact while maintaining social interaction either virtual or remote.

sourceString: The use of the term "social distancing" had led to implications that people should engage in complete social isolation, rather than encouraging them to stay in contact with others through alternative means.Some authorities have issued sexual health guidelines for use during the pandemic.
targetString: "सामाजिक दूरी बनाना" शब्द के उपयोग से निहितार्थ उत्पन्न हुए कि, लोगों को वैकल्पिक साधनों के माध्यम से दूसरों के साथ संपर्क में रहने के लिए प्रोत्साहित करने के बजाय पूर्ण सामाजिक पृथक्करण को अपनाना चाहिए। कुछ प्राधिकरणों ने महामारी के दौरान उपयोग किए जाने के लिए यौन स्वास्थ्य दिशानिर्देश जारी किए हैं।
en-mt: The implications arose from the use of the term "social distancing" that, instead of encouraging people to stay in touch with others through alternative means, they should adopt complete social isolation. Some authorities have issued sexual health guidelines to be used during the pandemic.

sourceString: These include recommendations to only have sex with someone you live with, who does not have the virus or symptoms of the virus.
targetString: इनमें केवल आपके साथ रहने वाले व्यक्ति, जिसमें वायरस या वायरस के लक्षण नहीं हैं, के साथ यौन संबंध बनाने की अनुशंसाएं शामिल हैं।
en-mt: These include recommendations for having sex only with a person living with you who does not have symptoms of the virus or virus.

sourceString: Self-isolation at home has been recommended for those diagnosed with COVID-19 and those who suspect they have been infected.
targetString: COVID-19 का निदान किए गए लोगों और जिन लोगों को संक्रमित होने का संदेह है, उनके लिए घर पर स्व-पृथक्करण की अनुशंसा की गई है।
en-mt: Self-isolation at home has been recommended for people diagnosed with COVID-19 and those suspected of being infected.

sourceString: Health agencies have issued detailed instructions for proper self-isolation.Many governments have mandated or recommended self-quarantine for entire populations living in affected areas.
targetString: स्वास्थ्य एजेंसियों ने उचित स्व-पृथक्करण के लिए विस्तृत निर्देश जारी किए हैं। कई सरकारों ने प्रभावित क्षेत्रों में रहने वाली संपूर्ण आबादी के लिए स्व-क्वारंटीन को अनिवार्य या अनुशंसित किया है।
en-mt: Health agencies have issued detailed instructions for proper self-isolation. Many governments have mandated or recommended self-quarantine for the entire population living in the affected areas.

sourceString: The strongest self-quarantine instructions have been issued to those in high risk groups.
targetString: उच्च जोखिम वाले समूहों में सबसे कड़े स्व-क्वारंटीन निर्देशें जारी किए गए हैं।
en-mt: The most stringent self-quarantine instructions have been issued in high-risk groups.

sourceString: Those who may have been exposed to someone with COVID-19 and those who have recently travelled to a country or region with widespread transmission have been advised to self-quarantine for 14 days from the time of last possible exposure.
targetString: जो व्यक्ति COVID-19 से संक्रमित किसी व्यक्ति के संपर्क में आए हो सकते हैं और जो व्यक्ति हाल ही में व्यापक संचरण वाले किसी देश या क्षेत्र में गए हैं, उन्हें अंतिम संभावित जोखिम के समय से 14 दिनों के लिए स्व-क्वारंटीन करने की सलाह दी गई है।
en-mt: Persons who may have come in contact with someone infected with COVID-19 and individuals who have recently travelled to a country or region with widespread transmission have been advised to self-quarantine for 14 days from the time of the last possible exposure.

sourceString: Strategies in the control of an outbreak are containment or suppression, and mitigation.
targetString: एक प्रकोप के नियंत्रण की रणनीतियाँ संरोधन या दमन, और शमन हैं।
en-mt: The strategies for control of an outbreak are contraception or suppression, and mitigation.

sourceString: Containment is undertaken in the early stages of the outbreak and aims to trace and isolate those infected as well as introduce other measures of infection control and vaccinations to stop the disease from spreading to the rest of the population.
targetString: प्रकोप की प्रारंभिक अवस्थाओं में संरोधन को किया जाता है और इसका उद्देश्य संक्रमित लोगों का पता लगाना और साथ ही संक्रमण को नियंत्रित करने के अन्य उपायों और टीकाकरण को लागू करना है ताकि रोग को शेष आबादी में फैलने से रोका जा सके।
en-mt: Contraception is carried out in the early stages of the outbreak and is aimed at detecting infected people as well as implementing other measures to control the infection and vaccination to prevent the disease from spreading to the rest of the population.

sourceString: When it is no longer possible to contain the spread of the disease, efforts then move to the mitigation stage: measures are taken to slow the spread and mitigate its effects on the healthcare system and society.
targetString: जब रोग के प्रसार को रोकना संभव नहीं होता है, तब प्रयास शमन अवस्था में चले जाते हैं: प्रसार को धीमा करने और स्वास्थ्य प्रणाली और समाज पर इसके प्रभावों को कम करने के लिए उपायों को किया जाता है।
en-mt: When it is not possible to stop the spread of the disease, efforts go into a mitigation state: measures are taken to slow the spread and reduce its effects on the health system and society.

sourceString: A combination of both containment and mitigation measures may be undertaken at the same time.
targetString: संरोधन और शमन दोनों उपायों का संयोजन एक ही समय में किया जा सकता है।
en-mt: A combination of both containment and mitigation measures can be done at the same time.

sourceString: Suppression requires more extreme measures so as to reverse the pandemic by reducing the basic reproduction number to less than 1.Part of managing an infectious disease outbreak is trying to decrease the epidemic peak, known as flattening the epidemic curve.
targetString: दमन के लिए अधिक चरम उपायों की आवश्यकता होती है, ताकि मूल प्रजनन संख्या को 1 से कम करके महामारी को उलटा जा सके। संक्रामक रोग के प्रकोप का प्रबंधन करने का एक भाग महामारी की चरम सीमा को कम करने की कोशिश करना है, जिसे महामारी वक्र को कम करने के रूप में जाना जाता है।
en-mt: Suppression requires more extreme measures, so that the epidemic can be reversed by reducing the original reproduction number to less than 1. Part of managing an infectious disease outbreak is to try to reduce the extremes of an epidemic, known as reducing the epidemic curve.

sourceString: This decreases the risk of health services being overwhelmed and provides more time for vaccines and treatments to be developed.
targetString: इससे स्वास्थ्य सेवाओं के चरमराने के जोखिम में कमी आती है और टीकों और उपचारों को विकसित करने के लिए अधिक समय मिलता है।
en-mt: This reduces the risk of health services collapsing and gives more time to develop vaccines and treatments.

sourceString: Non-pharmaceutical interventions that may manage the outbreak include personal preventive measures, such as hand hygiene, wearing face-masks, and self-quarantine; community measures aimed at physical distancing such as closing schools and cancelling mass gathering events; community engagement to encourage acceptance and participation in such interventions; as well as environmental measures such surface cleaning.More drastic actions aimed at containing the outbreak were taken in China once the severity of the outbreak became apparent, such as quarantining entire cities and imposing strict travel bans.
targetString: गैर-औषधीय हस्तक्षेप जो प्रकोप का प्रबंधन कर सकते हैं, उनमें व्यक्तिगत निवारक उपाय शामिल हैं, जैसे कि हाथों की स्वच्छता, चेहरे पर मास्क पहनना और स्व-क्वारंटीन; शारीरिक दूरी बनाने के लिए आशयित सामुदायिक उपाय जैसे स्कूलों को बंद करना और सामूहिक सभा कार्यक्रमों को रद्द करना; ऐसे हस्तक्षेपों में स्वीकृति और भागीदारी को प्रोत्साहित करने के लिए सामुदायिक सहभागिता; साथ ही पर्यावरणीय उपायों जैसे सतहों की सफाई प्रयोजित है। प्रकोप के संरोधन के उद्देश्य से अधिक कठोर कार्यवाहियों को चीन में किया गया था जब प्रकोप की गंभीरता स्पष्ट हो गई थी, जैसे पूरे शहरों को क्वारंटीन करना और सख्त यात्रा प्रतिबंध लगाना।
en-mt: Non-pharmacological interventions that can manage the outbreak include individual preventive measures, such as hand hygiene, wearing face masks and self-quarantine; Community measures intended to maintain physical distancing such as closing schools and cancelling mass gathering events; community engagement to encourage acceptance and participation in such interventions; Also environmental measures such as cleaning of surfaces are sponsored. More stringent actions aimed at containing the outbreak were carried out in China when the severity of the outbreak became apparent, such as quarantining entire cities and imposing strict travel restrictions.

sourceString: Other countries also adopted a variety of measures aimed at limiting the spread of the virus.
targetString: अन्य देशों ने भी वायरस के प्रसार को सीमित करने के उद्देश्य से कई प्रकार के उपायों को अपनाया।
en-mt: Other countries also adopted a variety of measures aimed at limiting the spread of the virus.

sourceString: South Korea introduced mass screening and localized quarantines, and issued alerts on the movements of infected individuals.
targetString: दक्षिण कोरिया ने बड़े पैमाने पर जांच और स्थानीयकृत क्वारंटीन को शुरू किया, और संक्रमित व्यक्तियों की आवाजाही पर चेतावनियाँ जारी करीं।
en-mt: South Korea began mass testing and localized quarantine, and issued warnings on the movement of infected individuals.

sourceString: Singapore provided financial support for those infected who quarantined themselves and imposed large fines for those who failed to do so.
targetString: सिंगापुर ने उन संक्रमित लोगों के लिए वित्तीय सहायता प्रदान की जिन्होंने स्वयं को क्वारंटीन किया और जो लोग ऐसा करने में विफल रहे, उन पर बड़ा जुर्माना लगाया।
en-mt: Singapore provided financial assistance for those infected who quarantined themselves and imposed large fines on those who failed to do so.

sourceString: Taiwan increased face mask production and penalized hoarding of medical supplies.Simulations for Great Britain and the United States show that mitigation (slowing but not stopping epidemic spread) and suppression (reversing epidemic growth) have major challenges.
targetString: ताइवान ने चेहरे के मास्क के उत्पादन में वृद्धि की और चिकित्सा आपूर्तियों की जमाखोरी को दंडित किया। ग्रेट ब्रिटेन और अमेरिका के लिए अनुकरण दर्शाते हैं कि शमन (महामारी के प्रसार को धीमा करना लेकिन रोकना नहीं) और दमन (महामारी के विकास को उलटना) में बड़ी चुनौतियाँ हैं।
en-mt: Taiwan increased the production of face masks and punished the hoarding of medical supplies. Simulations for Great Britain and the US demonstrate that there are major challenges in mitigation (slowing but not stopping the spread of the pandemic) and suppression (reversing the evolution of the pandemic).

sourceString: Optimal mitigation policies might reduce peak healthcare demand by 2/3 and deaths by half, but still result in hundreds of thousands of deaths and health systems being overwhelmed.
targetString: इष्टतम शमन नीतियाँ चरम स्वास्थ्य देखभाल की माँग को 2/3 तक और मृत्यु को आधे तक कम कर सकती हैं, लेकिन इनके बाद भी सैकड़ों लोगों की मृत्यु हो जाती है और स्वास्थ्य प्रणालियाँ चरमरा जाती हैं।
en-mt: Optimal mitigation policies can reduce extreme health care demand by 2/3 and deaths by half, but these still result in hundreds of deaths and crumbling health systems.

sourceString: Suppression can be preferred but needs to be maintained for as long as the virus is circulating in the human population (or until a vaccine becomes available, if that comes first), as transmission otherwise quickly rebounds when measures are relaxed.
targetString: दमन को प्राथमिकता दी जा सकती है, लेकिन इसे तब तक बनाए रखने की आवश्यकता होती है जब तक वायरस मानव आबादी में फैल रहा है (या जब तक एक टीका उपलब्ध नहीं हो जाता है, अगर यह पहले हो), अन्यथा उपायों में शिथिलता से संचरण तेजी से लौट आता है।
en-mt: Suppression may be preferred, but it needs to be sustained as long as the virus is spreading in the human population (or until a vaccine becomes available, if it is earlier), otherwise the transmission returns rapidly from laxity in measures.

sourceString: Long-term intervention to suppress the pandemic causes social and economic costs.
targetString: महामारी के दमन के लिए दीर्घकालिक हस्तक्षेप सामाजिक और आर्थिक लागतें उत्पन्न करता है।
en-mt: Long-term interventions for epidemic suppression generate social and economic costs.

sourceString: There are no specific antiviral medications approved for COVID-19, but development efforts are underway, including testing of existing medications.
targetString: COVID-19 के लिए कोई विशिष्ट एंटीवायरल दवाएं अनुमोदित नहीं हैं, लेकिन मौजूदा दवाओं के परीक्षण सहित विकास के प्रयास चल रहे हैं।
en-mt: No specific antiviral drugs are approved for COVID-19, but development efforts, including testing existing drugs, are underway.

sourceString: Taking over-the-counter cold medications, drinking fluids, and resting may help alleviate symptoms.
targetString: बिना नुस्खे की सर्दी-जुकाम की दवाओं को लेने, तरल पदार्थ पीने और आराम करने से लक्षणों को कम करने में मदद मिल सकती है।
en-mt: Taking cold medicines without a prescription, drinking fluids, and resting can help reduce symptoms.

sourceString: Depending on the severity, oxygen therapy, intravenous fluids, and breathing support may be required.
targetString: गंभीरता के आधार पर, ऑक्सीजन चिकित्सा, अंतःशिरा तरल पदार्थ और श्वसन सहायता की आवश्यकता हो सकती है।
en-mt: Depending on the severity, oxygen therapy, intravenous fluids, and respiratory support may be needed.

sourceString: The use of steroids may worsen outcomes.
targetString: स्टेरॉयड के उपयोग से परिणाम बदतर हो सकते हैं।
en-mt: Steroid use can make outcomes worse.

sourceString: Several compounds that were previously approved for treatment of other viral diseases are being investigated for use in treating COVID-19.
targetString: कई यौगिक जो अन्य वायरल रोगों के उपचार के लिए पहले से अनुमोदित हैं, उनकी COVID-19 के उपचार में उपयोग के लिए जांच की जा रही है।
en-mt: Several compounds that are already approved for the treatment of other viral diseases are being investigated for use in the treatment of COVID-19.

sourceString: The WHO also stated that some "traditional and home remedies" can provide relief of the symptoms caused by SARS-CoV-19.
targetString: WHO के अनुसार कुछ "पारंपरिक और घरेलू उपचार" SARS-CoV-19 के कारण होने वाले लक्षणों से राहत दे सकते हैं।
en-mt: According to the WHO, some "traditional and home remedies" can relieve symptoms caused by SARS-CoV-19.

sourceString: Increasing capacity and adapting healthcare for the needs of COVID-19 patients is described by the WHO as a fundamental outbreak response measure.
targetString: COVID-19 रोगियों की आवश्यकताओं के लिए क्षमता बढ़ाना और स्वास्थ्य देखभाल को अनुकूलित करना, WHO द्वारा एक मौलिक प्रकोप प्रतिक्रिया उपाय के रूप में वर्णित किया गया है।
en-mt: Increasing capacity and optimizing health care to the needs of COVID-19 patients has been described by WHO as a fundamental outbreak response measure.

sourceString: The ECDC and the European regional office of the WHO have issued guidelines for hospitals and primary healthcare services for shifting of resources at multiple levels, including focusing laboratory services towards COVID-19 testing, cancelling elective procedures whenever possible, separating and isolating COVID-19 positive patients, and increasing intensive care capabilities by training personnel and increasing the number of available ventilators and beds.
targetString: ECDC और WHO के यूरोपीय क्षेत्रीय कार्यालय ने अस्पतालों और प्राथमिक स्वास्थ्य देखभाल सेवाओं के लिए कई स्तरों पर संसाधनों के स्थानांतरण लिए दिशानिर्देश जारी किए हैं, जिसमें शामिल हैं: COVID-19 परीक्षण पर प्रयोगशाला सेवाओं का ध्यान केंद्रित करना, जब भी संभव हो चयनात्मक प्रक्रियाओं को रद्द करना, COVID-19 संक्रमित रोगियों को अलग और पृथक करना, और कर्मियों के प्रशिक्षण द्वारा गहन देखभाल क्षमताओं में वृद्धि करना और उपलब्ध वेंटिलेटरों और बेडों की संख्या में वृद्धि करना।
en-mt: The ECDC and the European Regional Office of WHO have issued guidelines for the transfer of resources at multiple levels to hospitals and primary health care services, including: focusing laboratory services on COVID-19 testing, canceling selective procedures whenever possible, isolating and isolating COVID-19 infected patients,  and increasing intensive care capabilities by training personnel and increasing the number of available ventilators and beds.

sourceString: There are various theories about where the very first case (the so-called patient zero) may have originated.
targetString: इस बारे में कई मत हैं कि सबसे पहले मामले (तथाकथित रोगी शून्य) की उत्पत्ति कहाँ हुई हो सकती है।
en-mt: There are many opinions about where the first case (the so-called patient zero) may have originated.

sourceString: The first known case of the novel coronavirus may trace back to 1 December 2019 in Wuhan, Hubei, China.
targetString: नोवेल कोरोनावायरस के पहले ज्ञात मामले की पहचान वुहान, हुबेई, चीन में 1 दिसंबर 2019 में हुई।
en-mt: The first known case of novel coronavirus was identified in Wuhan, Hubei, China on 1 December 2019.

sourceString: Within a month, the number of coronavirus cases in Hubei gradually increased.
targetString: एक महीने के भीतर, हुबेई में कोरोनावायरस के मामलों की संख्या धीरे-धीरे बढ़ गई।
en-mt: Within a month, the number of coronavirus cases in Hubei gradually increased.

sourceString: These were mostly linked to the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market, which also sold live animals, and one theory is that the virus came from one of these kinds of animals; or, in other words, has a zoonotic origin.A pneumonia cluster of unknown cause was observed on 26 December and treated by the doctor Zhang Jixian in Hubei Provincial Hospital, who informed the Wuhan Jianghan CDC on 27 December.
targetString: ये अधिकतर हुनान समुद्री-भोजन के थोक बाजार से जुड़े थे, जिसमें जीवित जंतुओं को भी बेचा जाता था, और एक मत यह है कि वायरस इस प्रकार के जानवरों में से किसी एक से आया था; या, दूसरे शब्दों में, यह जन्तुजनित मूल का है। अज्ञात कारण वाला निमोनिया समूह 26 दिसंबर को देखा गया था और जिसका हुबेई प्रांतीय अस्पताल में चिकित्सक झांग जिक्सियन द्वारा उपचार किया गया था, जिसने 27 दिसंबर को वुहान जियांगान CDC को सूचित किया था।
en-mt: These were mostly linked to the wholesale market of Hunan seafood, in which live animals were also sold, and one view is that the virus came from one of these types of animals; Or, in other words, it is of zoonotic origin. The pneumonia group with unknown cause was seen on December 26 and was treated by physician Zhang Jixian at Hubei Provincial Hospital, who informed the Wuhan Jiangnan CDC on December 27.

sourceString: On 30 December, a group of doctors at Wuhan Central Hospital alerted their colleagues of a "SARS-like coronavirus".
targetString: 30 दिसंबर को, वुहान केंद्रीय अस्पताल के चिकित्सकों के एक समूह ने "SARS-जैसे कोरोनावायरस" के बारे में अपने सहयोगियों को सतर्क किया।
en-mt: On December 30, a group of physicians from Wuhan Central Hospital alerted their colleagues about the "SARS-like coronavirus".

sourceString: Eight of these doctors, including Li Wenliang, were admonished by the police for spreading false rumours, and another, Ai Fen, was reprimanded by her superiors for raising the alarm.
targetString: झूठी अफवाह फैलाने के आरोप में पुलिस ने ली वेनलियांग समेत आठ चिकित्सकों को चेतावनी दी और एक अन्य चिकित्सक आई फेन को उनके वरिष्ठों द्वारा फटकार लगाई गई।
en-mt: Police warned eight doctors, including Li Wenliang, for spreading false rumors, and another doctor, I Fen, was reprimanded by his superiors.

sourceString: The Wuhan Municipal Health Commission later released a public notice on 31 December and informed the WHO.
targetString: वुहान नगर स्वास्थ्य आयोग ने बाद में 31 दिसंबर को एक सार्वजनिक नोटिस जारी की और WHO को सूचित किया।
en-mt: The Wuhan Municipal Health Commission later issued a public notice on December 31 and notified the WHO.

sourceString: Enough cases of unknown pneumonia had been reported to health authorities in Wuhan to trigger an investigation in early January.During the early stages of the outbreak, the number of cases doubled approximately every seven and a half days.
targetString: वुहान में स्वास्थ्य प्राधिकरणों को अज्ञात निमोनिया के काफी मामले सूचित किए गए थे, जिसके परिणामस्वरूप जनवरी की शुरुआत में जाँच शुरू की गई। प्रकोप की शुरुआती अवस्थाओं के दौरान, मामलों की संख्या लगभग प्रत्येक साढ़े सात दिनों में दोगुनी होती गई।
en-mt: A considerable number of cases of unknown pneumonia were reported to health authorities in Wuhan, resulting in the launch of investigations in early January. During the early stages of the outbreak, the number of cases almost doubled every seven and a half days.

sourceString: In early and mid-January 2020, the virus spread to other Chinese provinces, helped by the Chinese New Year migration and Wuhan being a transport hub and major rail interchange.
targetString: जनवरी 2020 की शुरुआत और मध्य में, चीनी नव वर्ष के कारण आवाजाही और वुहान परिवहन केंद्र और प्रमुख रेल विनिमय होने के कारण वायरस अन्य चीनी प्रांतों में फैल गया।
en-mt: In early and mid-January 2020, the virus spread to other Chinese provinces due to the Chinese New Year movement and Wuhan being the transportation hub and major rail exchange.

sourceString: On 20 January, China reported nearly 140 new cases in one day, including two people in Beijing and one in Shenzhen.
targetString: 20 जनवरी को, चीन ने एक दिन में लगभग 140 नए मामले दर्ज किए, जिनमें बीजिंग में दो और शेन्ज़ेन में एक व्यक्ति शामिल था।
en-mt: On January 20, China reported about 140 new cases a day, including two in Beijing and one in Shenzhen.

sourceString: Later official data shows that 6,174 people had already developed symptoms by 20 January 2020.As of 26 March, the United States has overtaken China and Italy with the highest number of confirmed cases in the world.As of 9 April 2020, more than 1.61 million cases have been reported worldwide; more than 97,000 people have died and more than 364,000 have recovered.
targetString: बाद के आधिकारिक आँकड़ों से पता चलता है कि 20 जनवरी 2020 तक 6,174 लोगों में पहले ही लक्षण विकसित हो गए थे। 26 मार्च तक, विश्व में सबसे अधिक पुष्टि किए मामलों की संख्या के साथ अमेरिका ने चीन और इटली को पछाड़ दिया है। 9 अप्रैल 2020 तक, 1.61 मिलियन से अधिक मामले विश्वभर में सूचित किए गए; 97,000 से अधिक लोगों की मृत्यु हो गई है और 364,000 से अधिक लोग ठीक हो गए हैं।
en-mt: Subsequent official data shows that as of 20 January 2020, 6,174 people had already developed symptoms. As of March 26, the US has overtaken China and Italy with the highest number of confirmed cases in the world. As of 9 April 2020, more than 1.61 million cases were reported worldwide; More than 97,000 people have died and more than 364,000 have recovered.

sourceString: Around 200 countries and territories have had at least one case.
targetString: लगभग 200 देशों और क्षेत्रों में कम से कम एक मामला है।
en-mt: Nearly 200 countries and territories have at least one case.

sourceString: Due to the pandemic in Europe, many countries in the Schengen Area have restricted free movement and set up border controls.
targetString: यूरोप में महामारी के कारण, शेंजन क्षेत्र के कई देशों ने स्वतंत्र आवाजाही को प्रतिबंधित कर दिया है और सीमा नियंत्रण स्थापित किए हैं।
en-mt: Due to the pandemic in Europe, many countries in the Schengen region have restricted free movement and established border controls.

sourceString: National reactions have included containment measures such as quarantines (known as stay-at-home orders, shelter-in-place orders, or lockdown) and curfews.As of 2 April, nearly 300 million people, or about 90% of the population, are under some form of lockdown in the United States, more than 50 million people are in lockdown in the Philippines, about 59 million people are in lockdown in South Africa, and 1.3 billion people are in lockdown in India.
targetString: राष्ट्रीय प्रतिक्रियाओं में संरोधन उपाय जैसे क्वारंटीन (घर पर रहने के आदेश, अपने स्थान पर आश्रय के आदेश, या लॉकडाउन के रूप में जाना जाता है) और कर्फ्यू शामिल हैं। 2 अप्रैल तक, अमेरिका में लगभग 300 मिलियन लोग या लगभग 90% आबादी लॉकडाउन के किसी न किसी रूप में है, फिलीपींस में 50 मिलियन से अधिक लोग लॉकडाउन में हैं, दक्षिण अफ्रीका में लगभग 59 मिलियन लोग लॉकडाउन में हैं, और भारत में 1.3 अरब लोग लॉकडाउन में हैं।
en-mt: National responses include containment measures such as quarantine (stay-at-home orders, shelter orders at their location, or known as lockdowns) and curfews. As of April 2, nearly 300 million people in the US or about 90% of the population are in some form of lockdown, more than 50 million people in the Philippines are under lockdown, about 59 million people in South Africa are under lockdown, and 1.3 billion people in India are under lockdown.

sourceString: On 26 March, 1.7 billion people worldwide were under some form of lockdown, which increased to 2.6 billion people two days later—around a third of the world's population.
targetString: 26 मार्च को, विश्वभर में 1.7 अरब लोग लॉकडाउन के किसी न किसी रूप में थे, जो दो दिन बाद 2.6 अरब लोगों तक बढ़ गया - जो विश्व की आबादी का लगभग एक तिहाई है।
en-mt: On March 26, 1.7 billion people around the world were under some form of lockdown, which increased to 2.6 billion people two days later – about a third of the world's population.

sourceString: The first confirmed case of COVID-19 has been traced back to 1 December 2019 in Wuhan; one unconfirmed report suggests the earliest case was on 17 November.
targetString: COVID-19 के पहले पुष्टि किए मामले का वुहान में 1 दिसंबर 2019 को पता चला है; एक अपुष्ट रिपोर्ट से पता चलता है कि सबसे पहला मामला 17 नवंबर को हुआ था।
en-mt: The first confirmed case of COVID-19 has been detected in Wuhan on 1 December 2019; An unconfirmed report suggests that the first case occurred on November 17.

sourceString: Doctor Zhang Jixian observed a cluster of pneumonia cases of unknown cause on 26 December, upon which her hospital informed Wuhan Jianghan CDC on 27 December.
targetString: चिकित्सक जांग जिक्सियन ने 26 दिसंबर को अज्ञात कारणों वाले निमोनिया के मामलों का एक समूह देखा, जिसके बाद उनके अस्पताल ने 27 दिसंबर को वुहान जियांगान CDC को सूचित किया।
en-mt: Physician Zhang Jixian noticed a cluster of pneumonia cases with unknown causes on December 26, after which his hospital notified the Wuhan Jiangan CDC on December 27.

sourceString: Initial genetic testing of patient samples on 27 December 2019 indicated the presence of a SARS-like coronavirus.
targetString: 27 दिसंबर 2019 को रोगी के नमूनों के प्रारंभिक आनुवंशिक परीक्षण ने एक SARS-जैसे कोरोनावायरस की उपस्थिति का संकेत दिया।
en-mt: Preliminary genetic testing of patient samples on 27 December 2019 indicated the presence of a SARS-like coronavirus.

sourceString: A public notice was released by Wuhan Municipal Health Commission on 31 December.
targetString: 31 दिसंबर को वुहान नगर स्वास्थ्य आयोग द्वारा एक सार्वजनिक नोटिस जारी किया गया था।
en-mt: A public notice was issued by the Wuhan Municipal Health Commission on December 31.

sourceString: The WHO was informed on the same day.
targetString: WHO को उसी दिन सूचित किया गया था।
en-mt: The WHO was notified the same day.

sourceString: As these notifications occurred, doctors in Wuhan were warned by police for "spreading rumours" about the outbreak.
targetString: इन सूचनाओं के आने के बाद, वुहान में पुलिस द्वारा चिकित्सकों को प्रकोप के बारे में "अफवाहें फैलाने" के लिए चेतावनी दी गई थी।
en-mt: After these reports arrived, physicians were warned by police in Wuhan for "spreading rumours" about the outbreak.

sourceString: The Chinese National Health Commission initially claimed that there was no "clear evidence" of human-to-human transmission.
targetString: चीनी राष्ट्रीय स्वास्थ्य आयोग ने शुरू में दावा किया था कि मानव-से-मानव संचरण का कोई "स्पष्ट प्रमाण" नहीं था।
en-mt: The Chinese National Health Commission initially claimed there was no "clear evidence" of human-to-human transmission.

sourceString: In late January, the Chinese government launched a radical campaign later described by the Chinese Communist Party general secretary Xi Jinping as a "people's war" to contain the spread of the virus.
targetString: जनवरी के अंत में, चीन सरकार ने वायरस के फैलने को रोकने के लिए एक उग्र अभियान शुरू किया, जिसे चीनी कम्युनिस्ट पार्टी के महासचिव शी जिनपिंग द्वारा "लोगों का युद्ध" कहा गया।
en-mt: In late January, the Chinese government launched a furious campaign to contain the spread of the virus, which was called a "people's war" by Chinese Communist Party General Secretary Xi Jinping.

sourceString: In what has been described as "the largest quarantine in human history", a cordon sanitaire was announced on 23 January stopping travel in and out of Wuhan, which was extended to a total of 15 cities in Hubei, affecting a total of about 57 million people.
targetString: "मानव इतिहास में सबसे बड़ा क्वारंटीन" के रूप में वर्णित, 23 जनवरी को वुहान में आवाजाही को रोकने के लिए एक घेराबंदी क्षेत्र की घोषणा की गई थी, जिसे हुबेई में कुल 15 शहरों तक बढ़ाया गया था, जिसने कुल 57 मिलियन लोगों को प्रभावित किया।
en-mt: Described as the "largest quarantine in human history", a siege zone was announced on January 23 to stop movement in Wuhan, which was extended to a total of 15 cities in Hubei, affecting a total of 57 million people.

sourceString: Private vehicle use was banned in the city.
targetString: शहर में निजी वाहन के उपयोग पर प्रतिबंध लगा दिया गया था।
en-mt: The use of private vehicles was banned in the city.

sourceString: Chinese New Year (25 January) celebrations were cancelled in many places.
targetString: चीनी नव वर्ष (25 जनवरी) समारोह कई स्थानों पर रद्द कर दिए गए थे।
en-mt: Chinese New Year (January 25) celebrations were cancelled at several places.

sourceString: The authorities also announced the construction of a temporary hospital, Huoshenshan Hospital, which was completed in 10 days.
targetString: प्राधिकरणों ने एक अस्थायी अस्पताल, होशेंसन अस्पताल, के निर्माण की भी घोषणा की, जो 10 दिनों में पूरा हो गया था।
en-mt: The authorities also announced the construction of a temporary hospital, Hoshenson Hospital, which was completed in 10 days.

sourceString: Another hospital was built afterwards, Leishenshan Hospital, to handle additional patients.
targetString: अतिरिक्त रोगियों को संभालने के लिए बाद में एक और अस्पताल, लीशेंसन अस्पताल, बनाया गया था।
en-mt: Another hospital, Leeshenson Hospital, was later built to handle additional patients.

sourceString: In addition to newly constructed hospitals, China also converted 14 other facilities in Wuhan, such as convention centers and stadiums, into temporary hospitals.On 26 January, the government instituted further measures to contain the COVID-19 outbreak, including issuing health declarations for travellers and extending the Spring Festival holiday.
targetString: नवनिर्मित अस्पतालों के अलावा, चीन ने वुहान में 14 अन्य सुविधाओं जैसे सम्मेलन केंद्रों और स्टेडियमों को भी अस्थायी अस्पतालों में परिवर्तित कर दिया। 26 जनवरी को, सरकार ने यात्रियों के लिए स्वास्थ्य घोषणाएं जारी करने और वसंत महोत्सव छुट्टी के विस्तार सहित COVID-19 प्रकोप को रोकने के लिए अतिरिक्त उपाय स्थापित किए।
en-mt: In addition to the newly built hospitals, China also converted 14 other facilities in Wuhan such as conference centers and stadiums into temporary hospitals. On January 26, the government instituted additional measures to contain the COVID-19 outbreak, including issuing health announcements for travellers and extending the Spring Festival holiday.

sourceString: Universities and schools around the country were also closed.
targetString: देश भर के विश्वविद्यालयों और विद्यालयों को भी बंद कर दिया गया था।
en-mt: Universities and schools across the country were also closed.

sourceString: The regions of Hong Kong and Macau instituted several measures, particularly in regard to schools and universities.
targetString: हॉन्ग कॉन्ग और मकाऊ के क्षेत्रों ने कई उपाय स्थापित किए, विशेष रूप से विद्यालयों और विश्वविद्यालयों के संबंध में।
en-mt: The regions of Hong Kong and Macau instituted a number of measures, especially in relation to schools and universities.

sourceString: Remote working measures were instituted in several Chinese regions.
targetString: कई चीनी क्षेत्रों में दूर से कार्य करने के उपाय स्थापित किए गए।
en-mt: Remote working measures were established in many Chinese areas.

sourceString: Travel restrictions were enacted in and outside of Hubei.
targetString: हुबेई के भीतर और बाहर यात्रा प्रतिबंध लगाए गए थे।
en-mt: Travel restrictions were imposed within and outside Hubei.

sourceString: Public transport was modified, and museums throughout China were temporarily closed.
targetString: सार्वजनिक परिवहन को संशोधित किया गया था, और पूरे चीन में संग्रहालयों को अस्थायी रूप से बंद कर दिया गया था।
en-mt: Public transport was modified, and museums across China were temporarily closed.

sourceString: Control of public movement was applied in many cities, and it has been estimated that about 760 million people (more than half the population) faced some form of outdoor restriction.After the outbreak entered its global phase in March, Chinese authorities took strict measures to prevent the virus from "importing" from other countries.
targetString: कई शहरों में जनता की आवाजाही पर नियंत्रण लगाया गया था, और यह अनुमान लगाया गया है कि लगभग 760 मिलियन लोगों (आधी से अधिक आबादी) को बाहरी प्रतिबंध के किसी न किसी रूप का सामना करना पड़ा। मार्च में प्रकोप के अपने वैश्विक चरण में आने के बाद, चीनी प्राधिकरणों ने वायरस के दूसरे देशों से "आने" को रोकने के लिए सख्त कदम उठाए।
en-mt: Controls were imposed on the movement of the public in many cities, and it is estimated that about 760 million people (more than half the population) faced some form of external restriction. After the outbreak entered its global phase in March, Chinese authorities took strict measures to prevent the virus from "coming" from other countries.

sourceString: For example, Beijing has imposed a 14-day mandatory quarantine for all international travellers entering the city.On 23 March, mainland China only one case had transmitted domestically in the five days prior, in this instance via a traveller returning to Guangzhou from Istanbul.
targetString: उदाहरण के लिए, बीजिंग ने शहर में प्रवेश करने वाले सभी अंतर्राष्ट्रीय यात्रियों के लिए 14-दिन का अनिवार्य क्वारंटीन लगाया है। 23 मार्च को, मुख्य भूमि चीन में पिछले पांच दिनों में घरेलू स्तर पर केवल एक मामला संचारित हुआ था, इस उदाहरण में इस्तांबुल से ग्वांगझू लौट रहे एक यात्री के माध्यम से।
en-mt: Beijing, for example, has imposed a 14-day mandatory quarantine for all international travellers entering the city. On March 23, only one case was transmitted domestically in the past five days in mainland China, in this instance via a passenger returning from Istanbul to Guangzhou.

sourceString: On 24 March 2020, Chinese Premier Li Keqiang reported that the spread of domestically transmitted cases has been basically blocked and the outbreak has been controlled in China.
targetString: 24 मार्च 2020 को, चीनी प्रीमियर ली केकियांग ने सूचित किया कि घरेलू स्तर पर संचारित होने वाले मामलों के फैलने को मूल रूप से रोक दिया गया है और चीन में प्रकोप नियंत्रित हो गया है।
en-mt: On 24th March 2020, Chinese Premier Li Keqiang informed that the spread of domestically transmitted cases has been basically stopped and the outbreak in China has been controlled.

sourceString: The same day travel restrictions were eased in Hubei, apart from Wuhan, two months after the lockdown was imposed.The Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs announced on 26 March 2020 that entry for visa or residence permit holders would be suspended from 28 March onwards, with no specific details on when this policy will end.
targetString: लॉकडाउन लगाने के दो महीने बाद उसी दिन वुहान के अलावा हुबेई में यात्रा प्रतिबंधों में राहत दी गई थी। चीनी विदेश मंत्रालय ने 26 मार्च 2020 को घोषणा करी कि वीज़ा या आवास अनुज्ञा पत्र धारकों के लिए प्रवेश 28 मार्च से निलंबित कर दिया जाएगा, साथ ही यह नीति कब समाप्त होगी, इस पर कोई विशेष विवरण नहीं है।
en-mt: Travel restrictions were eased in Hubei in addition to Wuhan on the same day, two months after the lockdown was imposed. The Chinese Foreign Ministry announced on 26 March 2020 that entry for visa or residence permit holders will be suspended from 28 March, with no specific details on when this policy will end.

sourceString: Those who wish to enter China will have to apply for visas in Chinese embassies or consulates.
targetString: जो लोग चीन में प्रवेश करना चाहते हैं उन्हें चीनी दूतावासों या वाणिज्य दूतावासों में वीज़ा के लिए आवेदन करना होगा।
en-mt: Those who want to enter China will have to apply for a visa at Chinese embassies or consulates.

sourceString: The Chinese government encouraged businesses and factories to re-open on 30 March, and provided monetary stimulus packages for firms.The State Council declared a day of mourning to begin with a national three-minute moment of silence on 10:00 4 April, coinciding with Qingming Festival, although the central government asked families to pay their respects online in observance of physical distancing as to avoid a renewed COVID-19 outbreak.
targetString: चीनी सरकार ने 30 मार्च को व्यवसायों और कारखानों को फिर से खोलने के लिए प्रोत्साहित किया और व्यवसायों के लिए आर्थिक प्रोत्साहन पैकेज प्रदान किए। राज्य परिषद ने 10:00 बजे 4 अप्रैल को, तीन मिनट के राष्ट्रीय मौन के साथ शुरुआत करके शोक का एक दिन घोषित किया, जो किंगमिंग उत्सव के समय पर था, यद्दपि केंद्र सरकार ने परिवारों से कहा कि वे नए COVID-19 प्रकोप से बचने के लिए शारीरिक दूरी बनाने का पालन करते हुए ऑनलाइन श्रद्धांजली अर्पित करें।
en-mt: The Chinese government encouraged businesses and factories to reopen on March 30 and provided economic stimulus packages for businesses. The State Council declared a day of mourning at 10:00 a.m. on April 4, beginning with a three-minute national silence that coincided with the Qingming celebration, although the central government asked families to pay tribute online while adhering to physical distancing to avoid the new COVID-19 outbreak.

sourceString: COVID-19 was confirmed to have spread to South Korea on 20 January 2020 from China.
targetString: 20 जनवरी 2020 को चीन से दक्षिण कोरिया में COVID-19 के फैलने की पुष्टि की गई थी।
en-mt: The outbreak of COVID-19 from China to South Korea was confirmed on 20 January 2020.

sourceString: The nation's health agency reported a significant increase in confirmed cases on 20 February, largely attributed to a gathering in Daegu of a new religious movement known as the Shincheonji Church of Jesus.
targetString: राष्ट्र की स्वास्थ्य एजेंसी ने 20 फरवरी को पुष्टि किए गए मामलों में उल्लेखनीय वृद्धि दर्ज की, जिसका संबंध बड़े पैमाने पर यीशु के शिंचियोंजी चर्च के रूप में जाने वाले एक नए धार्मिक आंदोलन के डाइगू में भीड़ जमा होने से था।
en-mt: The nation's health agency reported a significant increase in confirmed cases on February 20, largely linked to the crowding at Digu, a new religious movement known as the Shinchionji Church of Jesus.

sourceString: Shincheonji devotees visiting Daegu from Wuhan were suspected to be the origin of the outbreak.
targetString: वुहान से डाइगू आने वाले शिंचियोंजी भक्त प्रकोप की उत्पत्ति के संदिग्ध थे।
en-mt: Shinchionji devotees coming to Daigu from Wuhan were suspicious of the origin of the outbreak.

sourceString: As of 22 February, among 9,336 followers of the church, 1,261 or about 13% reported symptoms.South Korea declared the highest level of alert on 23 February 2020.
targetString: 22 फरवरी तक, चर्च के 9,336 अनुयायियों में से 1,261 या लगभग 13% ने लक्षणों की सूचना दी। दक्षिण कोरिया ने 23 फरवरी 2020 को उच्चतम स्तर की चेतावनी घोषित की।
en-mt: As of February 22, 1,261 of the church's 9,336 followers, or about 13%, reported symptoms. South Korea declared the highest level of warning on 23 February 2020.

sourceString: On 28 February, more than 2,000 confirmed cases were reported in Korea, rising to 3,150 on 29 February.
targetString: 28 फरवरी को, कोरिया में 2,000 से अधिक पुष्टि किए गए मामले दर्ज किए गए, जो 29 फरवरी को बढ़कर 3,150 हो गए।
en-mt: On February 28, Korea recorded more than 2,000 confirmed cases, which increased to 3,150 on February 29.

sourceString: All South Korean military bases were quarantined after tests confirmed that three soldiers were positive for the virus.
targetString: सभी दक्षिण कोरियाई सैन्य ठिकानों को क्वारंटीन कर दिया गया जब परीक्षणों ने पुष्टि करी कि तीन सैनिक वायरस के लिए पॉज़िटिव थे।
en-mt: All South Korean military bases were quarantined after tests confirmed that three soldiers were positive for the virus.

sourceString: Airline schedules were also affected and therefore they were changed.South Korea introduced what was considered the largest and best-organized programme in the world to screen the population for the virus, and isolate any infected people as well as tracing and quarantining those who contacted them.
targetString: एयरलाइन कार्यक्रम भी प्रभावित हुए थे और इसलिए उन्हें बदल दिया गया था। दक्षिण कोरिया ने जो कार्यक्रम पेश किया, वह वायरस के लिए आबादी की जाँच करने और किन्हीं संक्रमित लोगों को अलग करने के साथ-साथ उनसे संपर्क करने वालों का पता लगाने और क्वारंटीन करने के लिए विश्व में सबसे बड़ा और सबसे अच्छा संगठित कार्यक्रम माना गया था।
en-mt: Airline schedules were also affected and hence were changed. The program that South Korea introduced was considered to be the largest and best organized program in the world to screen the population for the virus and isolate any infected people, as well as to trace and quarantine those who came in contact with them.

sourceString: Screening methods included mandatory self-reporting of symptoms by new international arrivals through mobile application, drive-thru testing for the virus with the results available the next day, and increasing testing capability to allow up to 20,000 people to be tested every day.
targetString: स्क्रीनिंग के तरीकों में मोबाइल एप्लिकेशन के माध्यम से नए अंतर्राष्ट्रीय आगमनों द्वारा लक्षणों की अनिवार्य स्व-सूचना, अगले दिन उपलब्ध परिणामों के साथ वायरस के लिए त्वरित परीक्षण, और प्रतिदिन 20,000 लोगों का परीक्षण करने के लिए परीक्षण क्षमता बढ़ाना शामिल था।
en-mt: The screening methods included mandatory self-reporting of symptoms by new international arrivals through mobile applications, quick testing for the virus with results available the next day, and ramping up testing capacity to test 20,000 people daily.

sourceString: South Korea's programme is considered to be a success in controlling the outbreak despite not quarantining entire cities.The South Korean society was initially polarized on President Moon Jae-in's response to the crisis.
targetString: दक्षिण कोरिया के कार्यक्रम को पूरे शहरों को क्वारंटीन न करने के बावजूद प्रकोप को नियंत्रित करने में एक सफलता माना जाता है। दक्षिण कोरियाई समाज शुरू में राष्ट्रपति मून जे-इन की संकट के प्रति प्रतिक्रिया पर बँटा हुआ था।
en-mt: South Korea's program is considered a breakthrough in controlling the outbreak despite not quarantining entire cities. South Korean society was initially divided over President Moon Jae-in's response to the crisis.

sourceString: Many Koreans signed petitions either calling for the impeachment of Moon over what they claimed to be government mishandling of the outbreak, or praising his response.
targetString: कई कोरियाई लोगों ने या तो सरकार द्वारा प्रकोप के दुष्प्रबंधन का दावा करते हुए मून के महाभियोग का आह्वान करने वाली याचिकाओं पर हस्ताक्षर किए, या उसकी प्रतिक्रिया की प्रशंसा की।
en-mt: Many Koreans either signed petitions calling for Moon's impeachment, claiming the government's mismanagement of the outbreak, or praised its response.

sourceString: On 23 March, it was reported that South Korea had the lowest one-day case total in four weeks.
targetString: 23 मार्च को, यह सूचित किया गया कि दक्षिण कोरिया में चार सप्ताह में सबसे कम एक दिन के मामले थे।
en-mt: On March 23, it was reported that South Korea had the lowest single-day cases in four weeks.

sourceString: On 29 March it was reported that beginning 1 April all new overseas arrivals will be quarantined for two weeks.
targetString: 29 मार्च को यह सूचित किया गया कि 1 अप्रैल से सभी नए विदेशी आगमनों को दो सप्ताह के लिए क्वारंटीन किया जाएगा।
en-mt: On March 29, it was informed that from April 1, all new foreign arrivals will be quarantined for two weeks.

sourceString: Per media reports on 1 April, South Korea has received requests for virus testing assistance from 121 different countries.
targetString: 1 अप्रैल को मीडिया सूचनाओं के अनुसार, दक्षिण कोरिया को 121 विभिन्न देशों से वायरस परीक्षण सहायता के लिए अनुरोध प्राप्त हुए हैं।
en-mt: According to media reports on April 1, South Korea has received requests for virus testing assistance from 121 different countries.

sourceString: Iran reported its first confirmed cases of SARS-CoV-2 infections on 19 February in Qom, where, according to the Ministry of Health and Medical Education, two people died later that day.
targetString: ईरान ने 19 फरवरी को कोम में SARS-CoV-2 संक्रमण के अपने पहले पुष्टि किए गए मामलों की सूचना दी, जहाँ स्वास्थ्य और चिकित्सा शिक्षा मंत्रालय के अनुसार, बाद में उस दिन दो लोगों की मृत्यु हो गई।
en-mt: Iran reported its first confirmed cases of SARS-CoV-2 infection on February 19 in Qom, where two people died later that day, according to the Ministry of Health and Medical Education.

sourceString: Early measures announced by the government included the cancellation of concerts and other cultural events, sporting events, and Friday prayers, and closures of universities, higher education institutions, and schools.
targetString: सरकार द्वारा घोषित शुरुआती उपायों में संगीत कार्यक्रमों और अन्य सांस्कृतिक कार्यक्रमों, खेल के आयोजनों, और शुक्रवार की नमाज, और विश्वविद्यालयों, उच्च शिक्षा संस्थानों और विद्यालयों को बंद करना शामिल थे।
en-mt: Early measures announced by the government included the closure of concerts and other cultural events, sporting events, and Friday prayers, and universities, higher education institutions, and schools.

sourceString: Iran allocated five trillion rials to combat the virus.
targetString: ईरान ने वायरस से निपटने के लिए पांच ट्रिलियन रियाल का आवंटन किया।
en-mt: Iran allocated five trillion riyals to combat the virus.

sourceString: President Hassan Rouhani said on 26 February 2020 that there were no plans to quarantine areas affected by the outbreak, and only individuals would be quarantined.
targetString: राष्ट्रपति हसन रूहानी ने 26 फरवरी 2020 को कहा कि प्रकोप से प्रभावित क्षेत्रों को क्वारंटीन करने की कोई योजना नहीं थी और केवल व्यक्तियों को ही क्वारंटीन किया जाएगा।
en-mt: President Hassan Rouhani said on 26 February 2020 that there were no plans to quarantine areas affected by the outbreak and that only individuals would be quarantined.

sourceString: Plans to limit travel between cities were announced in March, although heavy traffic between cities ahead of the Persian New Year Nowruz continued.
targetString: शहरों के बीच यात्रा को सीमित करने की योजना मार्च में घोषित की गई थी, हालाँकि फारसी नव वर्ष नवरोज से पहले शहरों के बीच भारी यातायात जारी रहा।
en-mt: Plans to limit travel between cities were announced in March, although heavy traffic between cities continued ahead of the Persian New Year of Nowruz.

sourceString: Shia shrines in Qom remained open to pilgrims until 16 March 2020.Iran became a centre of the spread of the virus after China during February.
targetString: 16 मार्च 2020 तक कोम में शिया तीर्थस्थान तीर्थयात्रियों के लिए खुले थे। फरवरी के दौरान ईरान चीन के बाद वायरस संचरण का केंद्र बन गया।
en-mt: Shia shrines in Qom were open to pilgrims until 16 March 2020. During February, Iran became the epicentre of virus transmission after China.

sourceString: Amidst claims of a cover-up of the extent of the outbreak in Iran, more than ten countries had traced their cases back to Iran by 28 February, indicating that the extent of the outbreak may be more severe than the 388 cases reported by the Iranian government by that date.
targetString: ईरान में प्रकोप की मात्रा को छुपाने के दावों के बीच, दस से अधिक देशों ने 28 फरवरी तक अपने मामलों का ईरान से संबंध पाया, जो यह दर्शाता है कि उस दिन तक ईरानी सरकार द्वारा दर्ज किए गए 388 मामलों की तुलना में प्रकोप की मात्रा अधिक गंभीर हो सकती है।
en-mt: Amid claims of hiding the amount of the outbreak in Iran, more than ten countries found their cases to be linked to Iran as of February 28, indicating that the amount of the outbreak may be more severe than the 388 cases recorded by the Iranian government up to that day.

sourceString: The Iranian Parliament was shut down, with 23 of its 290 members reported to have had tested positive for the virus on 3 March.
targetString: ईरानी संसद को बंद कर दिया गया था, जब 3 मार्च को इसके 290 सदस्यों में से 23 में वायरस के लिए परीक्षण पॉज़िटिव आया।
en-mt: The Iranian parliament was shut down after 23 of its 290 members tested positive for the virus on March 3.

sourceString: On 12 March, the Human Rights Watch urged the Iranian prison authorities to unconditionally release the human rights defenders detained for peaceful dissent, and to also temporarily release all the eligible prisoners.
targetString: 12 मार्च को, ह्यूमन राइट्स वॉच ने ईरानी जेल प्राधिकरणों से शांतिपूर्ण विरोध के लिए हिरासत में लिए गए मानवाधिकार रक्षकों को बिना शर्त मुक्त करने और सभी योग्य कैदियों को अस्थायी रूप से मुक्त करने का भी आग्रह किया।
en-mt: On March 12, Human Rights Watch also urged Iranian prison authorities to unconditionally release human rights defenders detained for peaceful protests and temporarily release all eligible prisoners.

sourceString: It stated that there is a greater risk of the virus to spread in closed institutions like detention centres, which also lack adequate medical care.
targetString: इसने कहा कि संरोध केंद्रों जैसे बंद संस्थानों में वायरस फैलने का अधिक खतरा है, जिसमें पर्याप्त चिकित्सा देखभाल का भी अभाव है।
en-mt: It said closed institutions such as quarantine centres are at a higher risk of spreading the virus, which also lack adequate medical care.

sourceString: On 15 March, the Iranian government reported 100 deaths in a single day, the most recorded in the country since the outbreak began.
targetString: 15 मार्च को, ईरानी सरकार ने एक ही दिन में 100 लोगों की मृत्यु की सूचना दी, जो प्रकोप शुरू होने के बाद से देश में दर्ज की गई सबसे अधिक संख्या थी।
en-mt: On March 15, the Iranian government reported 100 deaths in a single day, the highest number recorded in the country since the outbreak began.

sourceString: At least 12 sitting or former Iranian politicians and government officials had died from the disease by 17 March.
targetString: 17 मार्च तक कम से कम 12 वर्तमान या पूर्व ईरानी राजनेताओं और सरकारी अधिकारियों की रोग से मृत्यु हो गई थी।
en-mt: As of March 17, at least 12 current or former Iranian politicians and government officials had died of the disease.

sourceString: By 23 March, Iran was experiencing 50 new cases every hour and one new death every ten minutes due to coronavirus.
targetString: 23 मार्च तक, ईरान में हर घंटे 50 नए मामले सामने आ रहे थे और कोरोनावायरस के कारण हर दस मिनट में एक नई मृत्यु हो रही थी।
en-mt: As of March 23, Iran was reporting 50 new cases every hour and a new death every ten minutes due to the coronavirus.

sourceString: According to a WHO official, there may be five times more cases in Iran than what is being reported.
targetString: WHO के एक अधिकारी के अनुसार, ईरान में जितने मामले सूचित किए जा रहे हैं, उससे पांच गुना अधिक मामले हो सकते हैं।
en-mt: According to a WHO official, there may be five times more cases than what is being reported in Iran.

sourceString: It is also suggested that U.S. sanctions on Iran may be affecting the country's financial ability to respond to the viral outbreak.
targetString: यह भी सुझाव दिया गया है कि ईरान पर लगाए गए अमेरिकी प्रतिबंधों ने वायरल प्रकोप के प्रति प्रतिक्रिया के लिए देश की वित्तीय क्षमता को प्रभावित किया हो सकता है।
en-mt: It has also been suggested that the US sanctions imposed on Iran may have affected the country's financial capacity to respond to the viral outbreak.

sourceString: The UN High Commissioner for Human Rights has demanded economic sanctions to be eased for nations most affected by the pandemic, including Iran.
targetString: मानवाधिकारों के लिए संयुक्त राष्ट्र के उच्चायुक्त ने मांग की है कि ईरान सहित महामारी से सबसे अधिक प्रभावित राष्ट्रों के लिए आर्थिक प्रतिबंधों में राहत दी जाए।
en-mt: The UN High Commissioner for Human Rights has demanded that economic sanctions be eased for nations hardest hit by the pandemic, including Iran.

sourceString: The outbreak was confirmed to have spread to Italy on 31 January, when two Chinese tourists tested positive for SARS-CoV-2 in Rome.
targetString: 31 जनवरी को प्रकोप के इटली में फैलने की पुष्टि हुई, जब रोम में दो चीनी पर्यटकों के परीक्षण SARS-CoV-2 के लिए पॉज़िटिव आए।
en-mt: The outbreak was confirmed to have spread to Italy on January 31, when two Chinese tourists in Rome tested positive for SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Cases began to rise sharply, which prompted the Italian government to suspend all flights to and from China and declare a state of emergency.
targetString: मामले तेजी से बढ़ने लगे, जिसने इटली की सरकार को चीन से आने-जाने वाली सभी उड़ानों को स्थगित करने और आपातकाल की स्थिति घोषित करने के लिए प्रेरित किया।
en-mt: Cases began to rise rapidly, which prompted Italy's government to suspend all flights to and from China and declare a state of emergency.

sourceString: An unassociated cluster of COVID-19 cases was later detected, starting with 16 confirmed cases in Lombardy on 21 February.On 22 February, the Council of Ministers announced a new decree-law to contain the outbreak, including quarantining more than 50,000 people from 11 different municipalities in northern Italy.
targetString: 21 फरवरी को लोम्बार्डी में 16 पुष्टि किए मामलों से शुरू करते हुए, COVID-19 मामलों के एक असंबंधित समूह का पता लगाया गया था। 22 फरवरी को, मंत्रिपरिषद ने प्रकोप को रोकने के लिए एक नए न्यायिक-कानून की घोषणा की, जिसमें उत्तरी इटली में 11 विभिन्न नगर पालिकाओं से 50,000 से अधिक लोगों को क्वारंटीन किया गया।
en-mt: Starting with 16 confirmed cases in Lombardy on 21 February, an unrelated cluster of COVID-19 cases was detected. On February 22, the Council of Ministers announced a new judicial-law to contain the outbreak, quarantining more than 50,000 people from 11 different municipalities in northern Italy.

sourceString: Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte said, "In the outbreak areas, entry and exit will not be provided.
targetString: प्रधान मंत्री गिउसेप कोंटे ने कहा, "प्रकोप वाले क्षेत्रों में, प्रवेश और निकास प्रदान नहीं किया जाएगा।
en-mt: "In areas with outbreaks, entry and exit will not be provided," Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte said.

sourceString: Suspension of work activities and sports events has already been ordered in those areas."On 4 March, the Italian government ordered the full closure of all schools and universities nationwide as Italy reached 100 deaths.
targetString: उन क्षेत्रों में कार्य गतिविधियों और खेल कार्यक्रमों को स्थगित करने का आदेश पहले ही दिया जा चुका है। "4 मार्च को इटली सरकार ने देश भर में सभी विद्यालयों और विश्वविद्यालयों को पूर्ण रूप से बंद करने का आदेश दिया, क्योंकि इटली में 100 मृत्यु हुईं।
en-mt: Orders have already been issued to suspend work activities and sports events in those areas. "On March 4, the Italian government ordered the complete closure of all schools and universities across the country, as 100 deaths occurred in Italy.

sourceString: All major sporting events, including Serie A football matches, were to be held behind closed doors until April, but on 9 March, all sport was suspended completely for at least one month.
targetString: सेरी A फुटबॉल मैचों सहित सभी प्रमुख खेल स्पर्धाओं को अप्रैल तक बिना प्रत्यक्षदर्शियों के किया जाना था, लेकिन 9 मार्च को, सभी खेलों को कम से कम एक महीने के लिए पूरी तरह से स्थगित कर दिया गया।
en-mt: All major sporting events, including Serie A football matches, were to be held without eyewitnesses until April, but on March 9, all games were postponed altogether for at least a month.

sourceString: On 11 March, Prime Minister Conte ordered stoppage of nearly all commercial activity except supermarkets and pharmacies.On 6 March, the Italian College of Anaesthesia, Analgesia, Resuscitation and Intensive Care (SIAARTI) published medical ethics recommendations regarding triage protocols that might be employed.
targetString: 11 मार्च को, प्रधान मंत्री कॉन्टे ने सुपरमार्केट और फ़ार्मेसी को छोड़कर लगभग सभी व्यावसायिक गतिविधियों को रोकने का आदेश दिया। 6 मार्च को, इटैलियन कॉलेज ऑफ एनेस्थेसिया, एनाल्जेसिया, रिससिटेशन एंड इंटेंसिव केयर (SIAARTI) ने नियोजित किए जा सकने वाले, गंभीर रोगियों की छँटाई के प्रोटोकॉल, के बारे में चिकित्सा नैतिकता अनुशंसाओं को प्रकाशित किया।
en-mt: On March 11, Prime Minister Conte ordered the closure of almost all business activities except supermarkets and pharmacies. On 6 March, the Italian College of Anesthesia, Analgesia, Resuscitation and Intensive Care (SIAARTI) published medical ethics recommendations regarding protocols for the pruning of critically ill patients that can be employed.

sourceString: On 19 March, Italy overtook China as the country with the most coronavirus-related deaths in the world after reporting 3,405 fatalities from the pandemic.
targetString: 19 मार्च को, इटली ने महामारी से 3,405 मृत्यु संख्या सूचित करने के बाद विश्व में सबसे अधिक कोरोनावायरस से संबंधित मृत्यु के मामले में चीन को पीछे छोड़ दिया।
en-mt: On March 19, Italy surpassed China in terms of the highest coronavirus-related death in the world after reporting a death toll of 3,405 from the pandemic.

sourceString: On 22 March, it was reported that Russia had sent nine military planes with medical equipment to Italy.
targetString: 22 मार्च को, यह सूचित किया गया कि रूस ने नौ सैन्य विमानों को चिकित्सा उपकरणों के साथ इटली भेजा था।
en-mt: On March 22, it was reported that Russia had sent nine military aircraft to Italy with medical equipment.

sourceString: As of 5 April, there were 128,948 confirmed cases, 15,887 deaths, and 21,815 recoveries in Italy, with the majority of those cases occurring in the Lombardy region.
targetString: 5 अप्रैल तक, लोम्बार्डी क्षेत्र में होने वाले अधिकांश मामलों के साथ, इटली में 128,948 पुष्टि किए, 15,887 मृत्यु के, और 21,815 ठीक होने वाले मामले थे।
